video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:00:26.970 --> 00:00:27.820
Don't worry.
00:00:27.820 --> 00:00:29.450
If you'd rather choose when to lock or
00:00:29.450 --> 00:00:33.910
unlock your doors, you can turn off
either or both features at any time.
00:00:33.910 --> 00:00:36.740
First, you'll need to
access programming mode.
00:00:36.740 --> 00:00:37.316
Here's how.
00:00:37.316 --> 00:00:41.015
[MUSIC]
00:00:41.015 --> 00:00:45.980
Turn the car on,
press the car unlock button three times.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:50.945
Turn the car off, press the unlock
button three more times and
00:00:50.945 --> 00:00:52.895
turn the car on again.
00:00:52.895 --> 00:00:56.185
You'll hear a chirp to let you know
you've entered the programming mode.
00:00:56.185 --> 00:00:57.435
Still with me?
00:00:57.435 --> 00:00:58.335
Good.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg3.mp4
question: What sound alerts you that you have entered program mode?

video_name: Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0
video_trans:
00:00:47.300 --> 00:00:51.375
Using the five way switch on your steering
wheel, from the settings menu, scroll to
00:00:51.375 --> 00:00:56.910
pre-collision, alert sensitivity, and
then select high, normal, or low.
00:00:56.910 --> 00:01:01.280
A lower setting will send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting with give earlier,
00:01:01.280 --> 00:01:02.250
more frequent warnings.

question: How many options of alert sensitivity is available in the system?

For more feature settings,
swipe left on the touch screen.

Touching Vehicle enables you to set your

00:01:19.930 --> 00:01:21.630

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:52.540 --> 00:00:56.902
To access the charge port light
preferences, using the touchscreen,
00:00:56.902 --> 00:01:00.113
touch settings, vehicle,
and charge port light.
00:01:00.113 --> 00:01:01.307
[MUSIC]
00:01:01.307 --> 00:01:03.600
The default setting is on.
00:01:03.600 --> 00:01:07.480
This means the port lights will illuminate
when you plug in, when the vehicle is
00:01:07.480 --> 00:01:13.080
charging, and anytime you press the unlock
button on your key fob or open the doors.
00:01:13.080 --> 00:01:16.370
Selecting Limited will prevent the port
lights from coming on while the vehicle
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:17.860
is charging.
00:01:17.860 --> 00:01:20.410
And Off will disable
all lighting features.

00:00:07.520 --> 00:00:09.500

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:12.168 --> 00:00:15.280
The customer placed trailer
camera prep kit can be mounted to
00:00:15.280 --> 00:00:16.530
the rear of a trailer.
00:00:16.530 --> 00:00:20.820
And provides added driver convenience
when backing up with an attached trailer.
00:00:20.820 --> 00:00:25.660
The kit includes a camera, wiring harness,
mounting bracket, and mounting parts.
00:00:25.660 --> 00:00:30.100
To use the camera requires the available
Sync 3 system, and either the available
00:00:30.100 --> 00:00:35.700
ultimate trailer tow camera system, or
rear center high mounted stop lamp camera.

video_trans:

a high-strength steel frame with enhanced
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.454

durability to help control your trailer.
00:00:17.454 --> 00:00:20.870
It also has something called
the Smart Trailer Tow Connector.
00:00:20.870 --> 00:00:24.692
You can access it under the towing tab
in the eight-inch productivity screen.
00:00:24.692 --> 00:00:27.872
It provides you with trailer connection
status along with lighting and
00:00:27.872 --> 00:00:30.510
trailer battery alerts, and warnings.

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:00:31.810 --> 00:00:36.120
When you come to a stop, the Brake Coach
screen appears in your display.
00:00:36.120 --> 00:00:38.830
And shows you your
braking efficiency score.
00:00:38.830 --> 00:00:41.820
You'll get higher percentages by
coming to gradual stops and
00:00:41.820 --> 00:00:46.220
100% means that you maximize
your braking efficiency.
00:00:46.230 --> 00:00:49.060
If at any time you want a quick
refresher on what this feature is,
00:00:49.076 --> 00:00:52.260
use the five way control on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:00:52.260 --> 00:00:56.420
Go to the Main Menu,
scroll to Information, Tutorial,
00:00:56.420 --> 00:00:59.320
then select Brake Coach and
a brief description will appear.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg3.mp4
question: How does the brake system work?

video_trans:

To get to the screen, use the five-way
switch on your steering wheel and
00:00:27.080 --> 00:00:33.070
scroll to Engage, Empower, MyView,
and then Miles/Full Charge.
00:00:33.070 --> 00:00:36.730
This screen will also show up when
you select EV Now mode using the EV
00:00:36.730 --> 00:00:37.640
button here.

video_trans:

In addition the system can help you
back in to a parking perpendicular or

traditional parking spot.

Just press the Active Park Assist
button two times.

Signal to indicate which side you want to
park on, then simply follow the prompts
00:01:26.350 --> 00:01:30.560

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:01:05.570 --> 00:01:08.790
If you want to tumble or
fold your entire seat forward for
00:01:08.790 --> 00:01:10.720
easier access to the third row,
00:01:10.720 --> 00:01:14.840
pull the handle up all the way until
the seat releases from the floor.
00:01:14.840 --> 00:01:18.350
Then flip the whole seat forward by
grabbing the bottom and pushing it up.

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:00:44.950 --> 00:00:48.607
In addition, your rear-view camera has
an enhancement that shows you an image of
00:00:48.607 --> 00:00:50.453
what's directly behind your vehicle.
00:00:50.453 --> 00:00:52.361
It's called Dynamic Hitch Assist and
00:00:52.361 --> 00:00:56.541
it has guidelines that can help you line up
your trailer when you're connecting it.
00:00:56.541 --> 00:01:00.271
The image appears in your center display
to help you maneuver when you're in
00:01:00.271 --> 00:01:04.710
reverse and to help you accurately
connect to your trailer without help.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg4.mp4

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
00:01:00.588 --> 00:01:05.024
High visibility LED box lights in the box
interior make it easy to find and
00:01:05.024 --> 00:01:07.350
load items in the dark.
00:01:07.350 --> 00:01:11.020
There are two lights located in
the rear corners that shine forward.
00:01:11.020 --> 00:01:14.770
There is also one in the high mounted
stop lamp on the rear of the cab.
00:01:14.770 --> 00:01:19.780
To turn them on and off from inside the
cab, just press the box lighting button, here.
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:22.760
After ten minutes they
will turn off gradually.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk_seg4.mp4

Did you know your Mustang's front seats

The front seats in your car

00:00:13.300 --> 00:00:16.490

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:00:13.370 --> 00:00:15.540
Once you've input
the correct measurements and
00:00:15.540 --> 00:00:18.270
placed the sticker as explained
in the how to set up video.
00:00:19.570 --> 00:00:21.130
When you shift into reverse,
00:00:21.130 --> 00:00:25.170
press the Camera button to expand
the menu options on the display screen.
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:28.420
Then press the Trailer icon and
select the trailer you want.
00:00:28.420 --> 00:00:34.030
You will then see the camera view on
the side where your trailer is moving,
00:00:34.030 --> 00:00:36.300
or both sides when the trailer
is directly behind you.
00:00:37.360 --> 00:00:41.960
Auto mode, which is the default mode,
changes views with the trailer direction.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg2.mp4
question: What should I press to expand the menu options on the display screen?

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:01:16.650 --> 00:01:20.350
Here are a few more things you'll
need to know when using the feature.
00:01:20.350 --> 00:01:24.990
After setting up and selecting a trailer,
the display always shows you a small top
00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910
view representation of your truck and
trailer.
00:01:27.910 --> 00:01:30.570
You'll also see two
different colored lines.
00:01:30.570 --> 00:01:34.766
A black line shows you where your
trailer is in relation to your vehicle.
00:01:34.766 --> 00:01:37.800
And a white line gives you a projection
of where your trailer will go
00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:40.420
based on your current
steering wheel position.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA_seg4.mp4
question: What line shows you where your trailer is in relation to your vehicle?

video_name: BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0
video_trans:
00:00:14.355 --> 00:00:17.840
Let's start with BLIS or
Blind Spot Information System.
00:00:17.840 --> 00:00:19.930
Any time you put your vehicle in drive and
00:00:19.930 --> 00:00:23.140
you are going faster than six
miles per hour BLIS will turn on.
00:00:23.140 --> 00:00:27.410
After that it's always active when
your vehicle is drive or neutral.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS With Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nOMzS_TkFT0_seg2.mp4
question: At what speed does BLIS activate?

video_name: 180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc
video_trans:
00:01:30.730 --> 00:01:34.460
The active guidelines, the ones that move,
show you the path in which your car is
00:01:34.460 --> 00:01:37.620
projected to go based on your
steering when reversing.
00:01:37.620 --> 00:01:39.920
These are perfect for
when you're backing into a parking space.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc_seg7.mp4
question: How does the active guide lines help the driver?

video_name: Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc
video_trans:
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:48.970
Just push up on the stalk to the single
triangle for a normal, continuous wipe, or
00:00:48.970 --> 00:00:50.840
to the double triangle for faster wiping.
00:00:52.090 --> 00:00:54.560
To wash the windshield,
just pull the stock towards you.
00:00:55.630 --> 00:00:57.840
So far, so good, right?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Front and Rear Wiper Stalk Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yUtE3AirOxc_seg3.mp4

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:00:14.754 --> 00:00:18.435
First, let's talk about how to
jump your battery if it dies.
00:00:18.435 --> 00:00:20.783
Open the engine hood by
pulling on the hood
00:00:20.783 --> 00:00:24.981
release located under the storage bin
next to the driver's side door, here.
00:00:24.981 --> 00:00:29.100
The battery jump box is located on the
driver's side of the engine compartment.
00:00:29.100 --> 00:00:33.072
Lift up the red access panel to
expose the positive battery post, and
00:00:33.072 --> 00:00:36.029
attach the positive end of
your jumper cable to it.
00:00:36.029 --> 00:00:38.537
Now, connect the negative
end to the ground,
00:00:38.537 --> 00:00:41.765
located on the inside of
the driver's side fender, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the battery jump box located?

video_trans:
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:31.890
Here, you can change the mode to alert
00:00:31.890 --> 00:00:34.440
which will vibrate your steering
wheel if you start to drift.
00:00:36.040 --> 00:00:39.990
Aid, which uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer the car back
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:40.886

00:00:40.886 --> 00:00:44.480

video_name: SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.405 --> 00:00:03.973
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.980 --> 00:00:07.180
Did you know that your vehicle may be
equipped with a feature
00:00:07.180 --> 00:00:11.520
that allows you to stay connected and control certain
features remotely, like unlock and
00:00:11.540 --> 00:00:14.900
lock your doors as well as
remote start your vehicle?
00:00:14.920 --> 00:00:19.208
All you need is the available
Sync Connect, a compatible smartphone, and
00:00:19.208 --> 00:00:20.170
Ford Pass.
00:00:20.170 --> 00:00:21.520
Let me tell you about it.
00:00:21.520 --> 00:00:25.340
The first thing you'll need to do is
download FordPass from the App Store or
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:28.500
Google Play and
accept the terms and conditions.
00:00:28.500 --> 00:00:33.491
If you already have a Ford owner account,
you can log in using your username and
00:00:33.491 --> 00:00:34.350
password.
00:00:34.350 --> 00:00:38.920
If not, you can create an account via the
FordPass app with some basic information
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:40.400
and a four digit PIN.
00:00:40.400 --> 00:00:43.820
You'll then need to add your
sync connect equipped vehicle.
00:00:43.820 --> 00:00:45.710
Go to the My Vehicles card.
00:00:45.710 --> 00:00:47.600
Click on Add Vehicle.
00:00:47.600 --> 00:00:50.610
To add a second vehicle hit the + button.
00:00:50.610 --> 00:00:55.500
Next, scan the VIN bar code by selecting
the Use Camera tab and point your
00:00:55.500 --> 00:00:59.920
phone's camera to the VIN label located
on your vehicle's driver door sill.
00:00:59.920 --> 00:01:02.530
You'll get a scanned successfully screen.
00:01:02.530 --> 00:01:05.570
Next, assign a vehicle nickname,
then, hit Finish.
00:01:06.590 --> 00:01:10.360
Next, you'll see this screen directing
you to activate SYNC Connect by
00:01:10.360 --> 00:01:13.200
touching the Activate SYNC Connect button.
00:01:13.200 --> 00:01:16.170
After a few minutes,
go to your vehicle and start it.
00:01:16.170 --> 00:01:19.630
You will then see this pop up
on the SYNC 3 touchscreen.
00:01:19.630 --> 00:01:20.800
Touch Allow to continue.
00:01:21.880 --> 00:01:25.843
Keep in mind, if you do not touch Allow
in the pop-up within 10 start-ups,
00:01:25.843 --> 00:01:28.306
you will not gain access
to remote features, and
00:01:28.306 --> 00:01:30.608
will need to reactivate
from the beginning.
00:01:30.608 --> 00:01:31.873
[MUSIC]
00:01:31.873 --> 00:01:36.091
Once you do, after a short period of time,
all remote features can be
00:01:36.091 --> 00:01:40.188
accessed from your smartphones
FordPass Vehicle Controls card.
00:01:40.188 --> 00:01:41.265
Any questions?
00:01:41.265 --> 00:01:44.705
Go to owner.ford.com or FordPass.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC Connect powered by FordPass - Activate Remote Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-MheqNWskp-s_seg1.mp4
question: How do you add your vehicle to the Ford Pass app?

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:12.168 --> 00:00:15.280
The customer placed trailer
camera prep kit can be mounted to
00:00:15.280 --> 00:00:16.530
the rear of a trailer.
00:00:16.530 --> 00:00:20.820
And provides added driver convenience
when backing up with an attached trailer.
00:00:20.820 --> 00:00:25.660
The kit includes a camera, wiring harness,
mounting bracket, and mounting parts.
00:00:25.660 --> 00:00:30.100
To use the camera requires the available
Sync 3 system, and either the available
00:00:30.100 --> 00:00:35.700
ultimate trailer tow camera system, or
rear center high mounted stop lamp camera.

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4
question: Where is the hybrid battery located?

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:00:22.760 --> 00:00:25.970
Summer tires are ideal for
performance vehicles and
00:00:25.970 --> 00:00:29.366
do not have the same traction
characteristics of all-season tires.
00:00:29.366 --> 00:00:32.902
As they are designed for
superior traction, cornering, and
00:00:32.902 --> 00:00:37.010
braking performance for
both wet and dry road conditions.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:41.240
This is attributed to specialized tread
patterns, like less grooving, to provide
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:46.159
more tire contact with the road, shallower
tread depth, and softer rubber compounds.
00:00:47.330 --> 00:00:51.550
Keep in mind, since summer tires
are composed of softer materials,
00:00:51.550 --> 00:00:53.360
they tend to lose flexibility.
00:00:53.360 --> 00:00:55.766
and are less suitable in colder temps and
00:00:55.766 --> 00:00:58.755
generally wear faster
than an all-season tire.
00:00:58.755 --> 00:01:02.646
And unlike all-season tires,
summer tires do not have a mud and
00:01:02.646 --> 00:01:05.601
snow traction rating and
are not recommended for
00:01:05.601 --> 00:01:09.870
cold weather below 45 degrees or
snowy and icy driving conditions.
00:01:11.220 --> 00:01:12.540
As a matter of fact,
00:01:12.540 --> 00:01:17.230
driving on summer tires in below
freezing conditions can damage them.
00:01:17.230 --> 00:01:21.590
If you must drive in these conditions,
Ford recommends using all-season or
00:01:21.590 --> 00:01:23.240
winter snow tires.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg2.mp4
question: What type of vehicles are summer tires ideal for?

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
00:00:46.760 --> 00:00:49.690
To put the seats back into their
original upright position,
00:00:49.690 --> 00:00:53.640
unfasten the prop rod and
stow it back into the slot in the floor.
00:00:53.640 --> 00:00:57.700
Then pull the entire seat down and
press it into its locked position.
00:00:57.700 --> 00:00:59.410
You'll hear it click into place.
00:00:59.410 --> 00:01:03.220
Finally, pull up on the shorter strap
closest to the seat back side, and
00:01:03.220 --> 00:01:04.600
flip the seat back up.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg2.mp4
question: Which strap do I need to pull in order to bring the seat back upright?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:02:29.841 --> 00:02:34.098
First, measure the horizontal distance
from the license plate to the center of
00:02:34.098 --> 00:02:35.889
the hitch ball and write it down.
00:02:35.889 --> 00:02:40.242
Next, measure the horizontal distance from
the center of the hitch ball to the center
00:02:40.242 --> 00:02:41.148
of the sticker and
00:02:41.148 --> 00:02:44.731
the distance from the rear-view
camera to the center of the sticker.
00:02:44.731 --> 00:02:49.037
Keep in mind, the location is not
dependent on a straight or A frame type,
00:02:49.037 --> 00:02:53.211
but based on where a surface is
available that meets the requirements.
00:02:53.211 --> 00:02:57.236
And finally, the horizontal distance from
the tailgate to the center of the trailer
00:02:57.236 --> 00:02:59.000
axle if it's a single axle trailer.
00:03:00.080 --> 00:03:01.280
If the trailer has two or
00:03:01.280 --> 00:03:05.000
more axles, measure to the center
point between both axles, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg5.mp4
question: What measurements need to be recorded?

glove box located on the passenger side.

Just press the button in

You'll notice that there's a hidden

00:00:46.340 --> 00:00:50.137

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:53.710 --> 00:00:56.530
When ECO Cruise is on but
not active, the ECO and
00:00:56.530 --> 00:00:59.880
car icon in your information
display will be gray.
00:00:59.880 --> 00:01:03.720
Once active both ECO and
the car icon will turn green.
00:01:03.720 --> 00:01:06.140
Now just accelerate to the speed you want.
00:01:06.140 --> 00:01:09.450
Then press the set button on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:01:09.450 --> 00:01:12.770
Your vehicle will keep a constant
speed until you brake.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:17.190
Keep in mind, if you do brake but
then want to resume your set speed again,
00:01:17.190 --> 00:01:20.490
you can press the resume button on
the left side of your steering wheel.

video_trans:

Okay, now I'll quickly discuss
the short strap mentioned earlier.
00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460
To fold the second row seats from
the third row, pull the short strap, and
00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980

00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer

Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150

00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.

However, if your light flashes rapidly and

you're not done yet and

video_name: Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.090 --> 00:00:06.099
[MUSIC]
00:00:06.099 --> 00:00:10.110
Your vehicle may be equipped with
inflatable rear outboard safety belts.
00:00:10.110 --> 00:00:13.222
They work similarly to standard
belts in everyday use.
00:00:13.222 --> 00:00:16.254
But in the event of an accident
they work a little differently.
00:00:16.254 --> 00:00:17.647
Let me explain.
00:00:17.647 --> 00:00:22.222
Unlike a standard safety belt the
inflatable outboard rear safety belt uses
00:00:22.222 --> 00:00:23.303
two retractors.
00:00:23.303 --> 00:00:25.981
One for your torso and one for your lap.
00:00:25.981 --> 00:00:30.081
To fasten it, just grab the tongue, that's
the part that connects the torso and
00:00:30.081 --> 00:00:30.820
lap portion.
00:00:30.820 --> 00:00:36.081
Pull the entire belt over your body at the
same time, then latch it into the buckle.
00:00:36.081 --> 00:00:39.196
Make sure to insert the tongue in
a straight-in motion to the buckle.
00:00:39.196 --> 00:00:42.434
This will help ensure
the inflation mechanism lines up.
00:00:42.434 --> 00:00:44.869
And that it inflates properly if needed.
00:00:44.869 --> 00:00:49.316
If you're in an accident, the crash system
in your vehicle will determine when, and
00:00:49.316 --> 00:00:52.176
if, the inflatable rear
safety belts should deploy.
00:00:52.176 --> 00:00:56.496
If they're needed, the air bags will
inflate with cold, compressed gas and
00:00:56.496 --> 00:01:01.149
expand across the passengers' bodies to
distribute the forces from the crash over
00:01:01.149 --> 00:01:03.551
a larger area to reduce
the risk of injury.
00:01:03.551 --> 00:01:04.604
Any questions?
00:01:04.604 --> 00:01:06.484
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:06.484 --> 00:01:16.484
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Inflatable Rear Safety Belt Owner Tips _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GIbrDEGm-hc_seg1.mp4
question: Are these safe to use with smaller children? (I know airbags can harm smaller children)

Your truck is designed to handle just

video_trans:
00:00:12.100 --> 00:00:14.900
>> Your car has a few features
that automatically lock or
00:00:14.900 --> 00:00:16.770
unlock all of your doors.
00:00:16.770 --> 00:00:19.910
Autolock will lock all of your doors
when your vehicle is moving and
00:00:19.910 --> 00:00:23.270
reaches a preset speed, and
Auto Unlock will unlock all
00:00:23.270 --> 00:00:26.970
of the doors when the car is turned
off and the driver's door is opened.

question: What does the auto-lock feature do?

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:38.526 --> 00:01:39.932
To remove the battery cover,
00:01:39.932 --> 00:01:44.100
first remove the small panel that
covers the negative battery cable.
00:01:44.100 --> 00:01:47.050
Once the panel is off, you'll need
to loosen the nuts on the negative
00:01:47.050 --> 00:01:49.680
pull clamps and
remove the cable from the battery.
00:01:49.680 --> 00:01:52.608
Next, unsnap the tab in the front, here.
00:01:52.608 --> 00:01:55.984
Then, slide the lid forward until
the two additional front-side tabs
00:01:55.984 --> 00:01:57.830
come unattached.
00:01:57.830 --> 00:02:01.028
Now, lift and pull the cover to remove it.
00:02:01.028 --> 00:02:03.426
Then, loosen the nuts on
the positive pull clamps and
00:02:03.426 --> 00:02:05.580
remove the clamps from the battery.
00:02:05.580 --> 00:02:09.139
Be sure to use the lift handles
provided when removing the batteries,
00:02:09.139 --> 00:02:10.539
since they are very heavy.
00:02:10.539 --> 00:02:14.739
You may have a single battery. To replace
it with the cover panel off, loosen and
00:02:14.739 --> 00:02:17.060
remove the negative pull clamp.
00:02:17.060 --> 00:02:20.798
Then rotate the battery and
remove the positive pull clamp.
00:02:20.798 --> 00:02:24.062
To install the new battery,
just follow the same directions, but
00:02:24.062 --> 00:02:25.180
in the reverse order.
00:02:26.520 --> 00:02:30.043
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg5.mp4
question: What do I do if I only have one battery to remove?

video_trans:

In fact, there are four different
gaps that you can choose from,
00:01:06.175 --> 00:01:11.504
one bar, two bars, three bars, or
four, and gives you the largest gap.
00:01:11.504 --> 00:01:14.031
Each one represents
a different driving style and
00:01:14.031 --> 00:01:17.590
will affect how quickly your vehicle
responds to changes in traffic.

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:00:14.754 --> 00:00:18.435
First, let's talk about how to
jump your battery if it dies.
00:00:18.435 --> 00:00:20.783
Open the engine hood by
pulling on the hood
00:00:20.783 --> 00:00:24.981
release located under the storage bin
next to the driver's side door, here.
00:00:24.981 --> 00:00:29.100
The battery jump box is located on the
driver's side of the engine compartment.
00:00:29.100 --> 00:00:33.072
Lift up the red access panel to
expose the positive battery post, and
00:00:33.072 --> 00:00:36.029
attach the positive end of
your jumper cable to it.
00:00:36.029 --> 00:00:38.537
Now, connect the negative
end to the ground,
00:00:38.537 --> 00:00:41.765
located on the inside of
the driver's side fender, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the battery jump box located under my engine hood?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:01:56.180 --> 00:01:58.840
And here are a few other tips
you might be interested in.
00:01:58.840 --> 00:02:02.180
To cool down your vehicle quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:02.180 --> 00:02:05.850
turn the nob toward the cool
setting to reduce the temperature.
00:02:05.850 --> 00:02:08.476
To warm your vehicle up quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:08.480 --> 00:02:11.160
turn your nob toward the warm
setting to increase it.
00:02:11.740 --> 00:02:16.036
To quickly defrost the windshield and side
windows, press the Max defrost button.
00:02:16.036 --> 00:02:17.348
Both the temperature and
00:02:17.348 --> 00:02:21.070
fan speed will automatically
adjust to the highest settings.
00:02:21.070 --> 00:02:21.710
In mild or
00:02:21.710 --> 00:02:25.910
warm temperatures, you may notice
that your A/C automatically turns on.
00:02:25.910 --> 00:02:29.300
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg9.mp4
question: How do I defrost my windows quickly?

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:01:09.170 --> 00:01:13.070
To manually shift gears,
move your gear shift from D to M.
00:01:13.070 --> 00:01:15.820
Now, only your current gear will appear.
00:01:15.820 --> 00:01:19.590
And you can use the plus button to up
shift and the minus to down shift.
00:01:19.590 --> 00:01:23.690
Keep in mind, even though you're manually
changing gears, SelectShift will prevent
00:01:23.690 --> 00:01:28.510
some shifts if your engine speed is
too high or if your RPMs are too low.
00:01:28.510 --> 00:01:32.710
And if you come to a stop while in Manual
Mode, the transmission will automatically
00:01:32.710 --> 00:01:36.600
downshift to a lower gear for
easier acceleration when you drive away.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg4.mp4
question: When do I have to use select shift?

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:45.570 --> 00:00:48.950
There are a few things that you may
need to know to prevent damaging them.
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:51.430
Before you put a jack
underneath your vehicle,
00:00:51.430 --> 00:00:54.790
you'll need to ensure that the power
running boards are turned off.
00:00:54.790 --> 00:00:58.400
Also, when using a jack,
be sure to check your owner's manual for
00:00:58.400 --> 00:01:00.440
proper mounting locations.
00:01:00.440 --> 00:01:04.510
And when using a hoist lift be sure to
place the lift arms under the frame rails
00:01:04.510 --> 00:01:09.130
at all times to avoid damage to the under
body and running board components.
00:01:09.130 --> 00:01:10.250
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg4.mp4
question: What must you turn off before putting a jack under your vehicle?

video_name: Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc
video_trans:
00:00:11.450 --> 00:00:13.100
Using the information display, and
00:00:13.100 --> 00:00:16.150
the five way control switch on
the left side of your steering wheel,
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:19.500
you can choose whether you want
your running lamps on or off.
00:00:19.500 --> 00:00:24.380
Just scroll to Settings, Vehicle,
Lighting, then Daytime Lights.
00:00:24.380 --> 00:00:26.750
If you have your daytime
running lamps set to on and
00:00:26.750 --> 00:00:30.430
want to use them, turn the lighting
control to the auto lamp position.
00:00:30.430 --> 00:00:34.110
When the lighting control is in auto lamp
position, and the head lamps are off,
00:00:34.110 --> 00:00:37.099
the daytime running lamps will turn
on automatically when you're driving.
00:00:38.530 --> 00:00:41.770
And will switch between daytime
running lamps and headlamps as needed.
00:00:41.770 --> 00:00:45.150
Based on how light or dark it is outside,
and whether or not the wipers are on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc_seg2.mp4
question: Which display can you use to change running lamp settings?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:18.866 --> 00:02:23.348
To switch between adaptive cruise control
or normal cruise use the 5-way switch on
00:02:23.348 --> 00:02:26.134
your steering wheel and
the information displays.
00:02:26.134 --> 00:02:30.544
Select Driver Assist, Cruise Control,
then select Adaptive to enable,
00:02:30.544 --> 00:02:33.847
or in Normal for
a conventional cruise control system.
00:02:33.847 --> 00:02:36.399
Meaning, it will not
automatically adjust speed,
00:02:36.399 --> 00:02:38.782
based on the speed of
the vehicle in front of you.

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:07.404
[MUSIC]
00:00:07.404 --> 00:00:10.866
The second and third row seats in your
Transit Connect wagon can be folded down
00:00:10.866 --> 00:00:13.800
when you need extra space for
transporting cargo.
00:00:13.800 --> 00:00:15.050
Here's how to do it.
00:00:15.050 --> 00:00:19.640
To fold the second row seats,
first push down the head restraints, like this.
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:24.793
Now, find the strap located on the side of
the seat back closest to the door, here.
00:00:24.793 --> 00:00:26.442
And pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:26.442 --> 00:00:28.665
[MUSIC]
00:00:28.665 --> 00:00:32.680
You'll notice that you have two straps on
the seat back, a long one and a short one.
00:00:32.680 --> 00:00:35.050
I'll tell you about the shorter one later.
00:00:35.050 --> 00:00:38.920
So, for now, find the longer strap and
pull up to unlock it.
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:41.850
Now, move the entire seat forward and
down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg1.mp4
question: What are the steps to lower the second and third row seats?

video_trans:
00:01:28.318 --> 00:01:30.480
The Search channels using voice command,
00:01:30.480 --> 00:01:32.680
use the voice button on your
steering wheel, wait for
00:01:32.680 --> 00:01:37.990
the beep then say browse Sirius, and
a full list of categories will appear.
00:01:37.990 --> 00:01:42.270
Touch the one you want to hear and once
you decide, touch the voice button and
00:01:42.270 --> 00:01:45.390
then say the channel number,
like, Sirius channel 36.
00:01:45.390 --> 00:01:50.290
Or you can use the Voice button and just
say the name or number of the channel,
00:01:50.290 --> 00:01:54.200
like ALT Nation, for example,
and it will tune to that channel.

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:44.190 --> 00:00:46.160
Now, let me show you how it works.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:50.420
The LATCH system consists of three
anchor points to secure your child seat.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.850
The two lower anchors in the seat bite,
where the back and the seat cushion meet.
00:00:54.850 --> 00:00:58.860
And the top tether anchor on the back
of or behind the vehicle seat, here.
00:01:00.520 --> 00:01:04.110
Attach the metal connectors on
the bottom of your child seat, remember,
00:01:04.110 --> 00:01:08.320
the ones that are either rigid or
on a strap, to the anchors,
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:11.350
which may be marked with
a child seat symbol, here.
00:01:11.350 --> 00:01:12.870
If your seat has straps,
00:01:12.870 --> 00:01:16.060
tighten them by pulling up until
the seat is secure and doesn't move.
00:01:16.060 --> 00:01:19.780
If your clips are on a rigid attachment,
push your seat back and
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:23.270
forth after you've attached it,
to make sure it doesn't move.
00:01:23.270 --> 00:01:27.190
Once you've installed your child seat with
the lower anchors of the latch system,
00:01:27.190 --> 00:01:31.910
attach the top tether strap under the head
rest, or over the top of the head
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:36.010
restraint, if it's not adjustable or
removable, and tighten the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg4.mp4
question: How do you secure your child seat using the anchors?

video_name: Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU
video_trans:
00:01:37.610 --> 00:01:40.350
Your vehicle also has
something called side sensing.
00:01:40.350 --> 00:01:44.550
It's an enhancement to your forward and
reverse sensing systems that uses a chime
00:01:44.550 --> 00:01:48.420
and a visual diagram display on your
touchscreen with red, yellow, and green
00:01:48.420 --> 00:01:52.160
highlights to indicate where the closest
object to your vehicle is detected.
00:01:52.160 --> 00:01:54.880
Red indicates the closest,
and green the farthest away.
00:01:56.054 --> 00:01:57.543
Any questions?
00:01:57.543 --> 00:01:59.036
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:59.036 --> 00:02:09.036
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Active Park Assist with Side Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fBF2E6gjwRU_seg6.mp4
question: How does the Side Sensor functions?

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4_seg1.mp4
question: Where is the release button located to but the seat backs down?

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:29.510 --> 00:00:32.320
Electric range is the estimated
distance you can travel
00:00:32.320 --> 00:00:35.280
while in plug-in power
mode with the engine off.
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:38.180
This range is based on
calculations determined by
00:00:38.180 --> 00:00:43.090
the amount of energy stored in the battery
and the energy being used while driving.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg2.mp4

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:37.500
With your gear shift lever in D,
00:00:37.500 --> 00:00:41.000
press the minus button to activate
progressive range selection.
00:00:41.000 --> 00:00:43.490
When you do,
you'll see the available gears
00:00:43.490 --> 00:00:47.150
as well as the current gear
indicated on the instrument cluster.
00:00:47.150 --> 00:00:51.350
So, if you press the minus button once,
it will lock out sixth gear.
00:00:51.350 --> 00:00:54.230
And press it again to lock out fifth,
and so on.
00:00:54.230 --> 00:00:57.640
Once you lock out gears,
only the available gears will be shown and
00:00:57.640 --> 00:00:59.960
your transmission will
automatically shift between them.
00:01:01.000 --> 00:01:03.950
The unlocked gears will automatically
reappear in the display
00:01:03.950 --> 00:01:05.070
when you restart your vehicle.
00:01:06.580 --> 00:01:09.170
To unlock a gear,
just press the plus button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg3.mp4
question: What happens when you press the minus button once & what happens when you press it twice?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:01:55.850 --> 00:01:59.360
Now, I'm going to tell you how to place
the checkered sticker I just mentioned.
00:01:59.360 --> 00:02:03.473
The sticker acts as a target with
the Pro Trailer Backup Assist feature and
00:02:03.473 --> 00:02:07.537
rear-view camera used to track which
direction the trailer is moving.
00:02:07.537 --> 00:02:09.147
Take the checkered target sticker and
00:02:09.147 --> 00:02:11.419
measurement card with you
to the rear of the vehicle.
00:02:11.419 --> 00:02:15.521
You want to place the sticker within 7 to
22 inches from the center of the trailer
00:02:15.521 --> 00:02:16.198
hitch ball.
00:02:16.198 --> 00:02:19.879
You'll need to make sure to place the
sticker on a flat horizontal service that
00:02:19.879 --> 00:02:21.681
is visible by the rear-view camera.
00:02:21.681 --> 00:02:24.369
This is where an assistant
would be helpful.
00:02:24.369 --> 00:02:28.192
One the sticker is in place, you'll
need to use your tape measure to get and
00:02:28.192 --> 00:02:29.841
record several measurements.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg4.mp4
question: Where should I place the sticker?

video_trans:

For your convenience,
00:00:14.500 --> 00:00:19.130
built in upfitter switches have been moved
to the overhead console for easy access.
00:00:19.130 --> 00:00:23.000
Plus, we've increased the number
of switches from four to six.
00:00:23.000 --> 00:00:27.292
So now, you have more capability to
control components, such as winches,
00:00:27.292 --> 00:00:29.580
electric spreaders, lights and more.

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:00:09.330 --> 00:00:13.670
Let me explain. Selectable Driving Mode
instantly modifies the electronic
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:17.230
stability control system and traction
control, which help maintain your vehicle's
00:00:17.230 --> 00:00:20.170
command of the road in poor conditions,
or high performance driving.
00:00:21.280 --> 00:00:24.220
It also enhances throttle response for
quick acceleration,
00:00:24.220 --> 00:00:29.170
crisper transmission shift points,
and finally steering effort and feel.
00:00:29.170 --> 00:00:32.270
Together the selectable driving
mounts automatically tailor your
00:00:32.270 --> 00:00:35.290
vehicles performance to
the mode you've selected.

video_name: How To Use Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-U2Z50I1apDA
video_trans:
00:00:13.370 --> 00:00:15.540
Once you've input
the correct measurements and
00:00:15.540 --> 00:00:18.270
placed the sticker as explained
in the how to set up video.
00:00:19.570 --> 00:00:21.130
When you shift into reverse,
00:00:21.130 --> 00:00:25.170
press the Camera button to expand
the menu options on the display screen.
00:00:25.170 --> 00:00:28.420
Then press the Trailer icon and
select the trailer you want.
00:00:28.420 --> 00:00:34.030
You will then see the camera view on
the side where your trailer is moving,
00:00:34.030 --> 00:00:36.300
or both sides when the trailer
is directly behind you.
00:00:37.360 --> 00:00:41.960
Auto mode, which is the default mode,
changes views with the trailer direction.

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:01:24.640 --> 00:01:28.230
Countdown provides a racing
Christmas tree style start timer.
00:01:28.230 --> 00:01:31.480
To use it, scroll to accelerator
timer in the track apps menu,
00:01:31.480 --> 00:01:33.670
and follow the prompts.
00:01:33.670 --> 00:01:36.800
Colors will flash in half
second intervals: yellow,
00:01:36.800 --> 00:01:38.080
green, red.
00:01:38.080 --> 00:01:42.550
If the driver accelerates early the light
will turn red indicating a false start,
00:01:42.550 --> 00:01:43.730
and no data will be recorded.

video_trans:

Language: en
00:00:00.279 --> 00:00:04.070
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.070 --> 00:00:07.650
Your vehicle may be equipped with the
feature that is designed to help alert you
00:00:07.650 --> 00:00:11.825
when a vehicle is in your blind spot while
travelling with or without a trailer.
00:00:11.825 --> 00:00:14.510
It can also alert you of
vehicles approaching when backing
00:00:14.510 --> 00:00:16.280
out of a parking space.
00:00:16.280 --> 00:00:17.860
Let me explain.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg1.mp4
question: Does this vehicle have alerts when backing out of a parking place?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg3.mp4
question: What does bliss do when a car moves into the right or left lane?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w
video_trans:
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.130
Auto Start-Stop technology is always on
00:00:17.130 --> 00:00:20.450
unless you turn it off by pushing
the Auto Start-Stop off button.
00:00:20.450 --> 00:00:23.760
So, it will be active every
time you start your vehicle.
00:00:23.760 --> 00:00:25.390
When you put your foot
on the brake pedal and
00:00:25.390 --> 00:00:29.625
come to a full start, like at a red light,
your engine automatically shuts off.
00:00:29.625 --> 00:00:31.530
You might not even notice it.
00:00:31.530 --> 00:00:34.720
But a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know that it's off.
00:00:34.720 --> 00:00:36.920
And, once you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:36.920 --> 00:00:40.240
your car automatically
restarts without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg2.mp4
question: Is there any delay when the engine restarts?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:02:11.050 --> 00:02:15.020
And one more thing, If you wish to
change to the conventional cruise mode,
00:02:15.020 --> 00:02:19.220
go to the menu settings on your instrument
cluster and select Cruise Control and
00:02:19.220 --> 00:02:20.110
then choose Normal.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg10.mp4
question: How do you change to conventional cruise mode?

video_trans:

You can also see your towing status, as
well as towing information like whether or
00:00:34.670 --> 00:00:37.703
not your trailer is connected and
a connection checklist.
00:00:37.703 --> 00:00:40.790
You can also access gain,
pitch, steering angle and
00:00:40.790 --> 00:00:44.950
trailer information for
up to ten trailers under the towing tab.

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:03:34.680 --> 00:03:38.160
Okay, now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the systems
00:03:38.165 --> 00:03:42.200
information display using
the five-way steering wheel controls.
00:03:42.200 --> 00:03:46.380
To input the measurements you recorded
outside of the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:46.380 --> 00:03:49.900
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:49.900 --> 00:03:53.960
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed, like this.
00:03:53.960 --> 00:03:58.510
Then OK to confirm each measurement and
to and to move onto the next measurement.
00:03:58.510 --> 00:04:00.310
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:04:00.310 --> 00:04:03.740
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:04:03.740 --> 00:04:06.255
If correct select confirm and hit OK.
00:04:07.400 --> 00:04:10.570
Once you confirm the measurements
the system will automatically search for
00:04:10.570 --> 00:04:13.720
the sticker target and
highlight it with the red circle.
00:04:13.720 --> 00:04:15.990
A message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:04:15.990 --> 00:04:18.590
If it is, select Yes to confirm.
00:04:18.590 --> 00:04:21.730
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know set-up is complete and
00:04:21.730 --> 00:04:22.640
measurements are saved.
00:04:23.870 --> 00:04:26.850
If you do not see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:04:26.850 --> 00:04:29.210
Make sure the measurements are correct,
and that the trailer and
00:04:29.210 --> 00:04:31.530
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:04:31.530 --> 00:04:35.710
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straight forward between four and
00:04:35.710 --> 00:04:37.340
25 miles per hour as directed,
00:04:37.340 --> 00:04:41.100
until you get a message confirming
calibration is complete.
00:04:41.100 --> 00:04:44.100
Keep in mind,
once you input your trailer's information
00:04:44.100 --> 00:04:47.360
into the information display,
it is stored for easy recall.
00:04:47.360 --> 00:04:49.960
So, you'll only need to do this one time.
00:04:49.960 --> 00:04:52.868
Every additional trailer will
require repeating the process.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg5.mp4
question: Can I revise the measurements after they are inputted into the system?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:00:26.970 --> 00:00:27.820
Don't worry.
00:00:27.820 --> 00:00:29.450
If you'd rather choose when to lock or
00:00:29.450 --> 00:00:33.910
unlock your doors, you can turn off
either or both features at any time.
00:00:33.910 --> 00:00:36.740
First, you'll need to
access programming mode.
00:00:36.740 --> 00:00:37.316
Here's how.
00:00:37.316 --> 00:00:41.015
[MUSIC]
00:00:41.015 --> 00:00:45.980
Turn the car on,
press the car unlock button three times.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:50.945
Turn the car off, press the unlock
button three more times and
00:00:50.945 --> 00:00:52.895
turn the car on again.
00:00:52.895 --> 00:00:56.185
You'll hear a chirp to let you know
you've entered the programming mode.
00:00:56.185 --> 00:00:57.435
Still with me?
00:00:57.435 --> 00:00:58.335
Good.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg3.mp4

video_trans:
00:00:10.560 --> 00:00:14.130
Let me tell you about it. The message
center or the productivity screen
00:00:14.130 --> 00:00:17.920
has a 4.2 inch screen that's located
between the tachometer and speedometer.
00:00:19.030 --> 00:00:21.720
Use the five-way switch on the left
side of your steering wheel
00:00:21.720 --> 00:00:26.190
to scroll to the main menu. From here, you

00:00:26.190 --> 00:00:29.940

00:00:29.940 --> 00:00:34.570

video_trans:
00:00:32.214 --> 00:00:35.677
Speaking of codes, your keypad comes
with one that's preprogrammed.
00:00:35.677 --> 00:00:39.395
Just enter that five digit code
to unlock the driver's door.
00:00:39.395 --> 00:00:42.880
Then press 3 4 to unlock all the doors.
00:00:42.880 --> 00:00:46.016
To pop your trunk or
your manual lift gate, enter the code.
00:00:46.016 --> 00:00:48.168
Then press 5-6.
00:00:48.168 --> 00:00:53.185
To lock all of your doors,
press 7-8 and 9-0 at the same time.
00:00:53.185 --> 00:00:54.032
[MUSIC]

Touching General and
00:00:55.790 --> 00:00:59.715
using the scroll bar allows you to set
your language, distance in miles or
00:00:59.715 --> 00:01:04.570
kilometers, temperature in Celsius or
Fahrenheit, touch screen sounds.
00:01:04.570 --> 00:01:08.400
Turn on automatic updates,
and perform a master reset,
00:01:08.400 --> 00:01:12.040
which returns all settings back
to the original factory settings.

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:01:04.590 --> 00:01:07.780
Using the navigation system
has also been simplified, so
00:01:07.780 --> 00:01:12.750
finding your nearest favorite coffee shop,
ATM, or any other popular destination
00:01:12.750 --> 00:01:17.580
can now be done quickly, thanks to
condensed destination entry functionality.
00:01:17.580 --> 00:01:21.530
Plus SYNC 3 remembers what you searched,
like coffee shops and
00:01:21.530 --> 00:01:23.200
saves it in its memory.
00:01:23.200 --> 00:01:26.820
So the next time you search for
a coffee shop, it'll remember and preload
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:30.800
POI search results based on the letters
you type and show you the closest one.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek_seg4.mp4
question: When you want a cup of hot coffe, can this give you directions to a shop?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:50.630 --> 00:01:53.520
Using the turn signal for
lane changes deactivates it.
00:01:53.520 --> 00:01:57.720
So it won't interfere in daily
driving with frequent turns and stops.
00:01:57.720 --> 00:02:01.630
Keep in mind, if you're driving and
don't have a firm grip on the wheel, or
00:02:01.630 --> 00:02:05.360
if you're on a straight part of the road
that doesn't require much steering input,
00:02:05.360 --> 00:02:09.290
the car may think you're not holding on,
and may alert you to do so.
00:02:09.290 --> 00:02:10.400
Any questions?

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:01:06.820 --> 00:01:08.680
If you have the available power seats,
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.510
using the switch located on the side of
the seat you can move the seats forward or
00:01:12.510 --> 00:01:15.320
backward by sliding it forward or
backward.
00:01:15.330 --> 00:01:18.970
To raise the seat bottom,
move the switch up or down.
00:01:20.160 --> 00:01:24.050
And to tilt, just lift the front of
the switch to tilt backward and
00:01:24.050 --> 00:01:25.500
press down to tilt forward.
00:01:25.500 --> 00:01:29.406
To set the firmest of the lumbar
support using the lumbar button,
00:01:29.406 --> 00:01:35.654
here, press the front of it to increase
the firmness and the back to decrease it.
00:01:35.654 --> 00:01:36.635
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc_seg5.mp4

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:45.230 --> 00:00:47.680
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:47.680 --> 00:00:52.470
you'll want to have the trailer screen up
on your LCD productivity screen, here.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:54.840
To get there, go to Truck Apps,
00:00:54.840 --> 00:00:57.930
then push the right arrow twice
until you see the trailer display.
00:00:58.940 --> 00:01:03.460
Unless a trailer is connected, the display
will read, Trailer Disconnected.
00:01:03.460 --> 00:01:06.740
As soon as a trailer is connected,
you'll see this message.
00:01:06.740 --> 00:01:08.100
Press OK.
00:01:08.100 --> 00:01:12.680
Once the trailer connected message
goes away, you'll see gain setting.
00:01:12.680 --> 00:01:16.370
This is what we talked about earlier, and
a bar graph that lights up to show you
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:19.390
the amount of power going
to the trailer brakes.
00:01:19.390 --> 00:01:23.960
From the trailer display, press OK, and
choose the Connection Checklist option.
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:27.640
It corresponds to
different trailer types and
00:01:27.640 --> 00:01:32.160
walks you through the connection process
to remind you of the necessary steps.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg3.mp4
question: How will I know if the trailer is connected?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:21.930 --> 00:01:26.230
Once plugged in and charging, the port
light will show the current charge status.
00:01:26.230 --> 00:01:30.020
When one bar is pulsing,
the charge is between 0 and 25%.
00:01:31.220 --> 00:01:34.017
One solid bar and
one pulsing bar is 25 to 50%.
00:01:34.017 --> 00:01:40.604
Two solids and one pulsing is 50 to 75%.
00:01:40.604 --> 00:01:44.169
Three solid and one pulsing is 75 to 100%.
00:01:45.300 --> 00:01:49.340
And when all four bars are solidly lit,
the charge is complete.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg5.mp4
question: How do I tell how much charge it has right now?

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:32.110 --> 00:00:36.110
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.110 --> 00:00:39.960
For best results, it's recommended to use
a draw bar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.600
drop to position your trailer level to
the ground. Then line up your vehicle and
00:00:44.600 --> 00:00:47.360
trailer by pulling forward, so
they're in line with one another.
00:00:48.500 --> 00:00:51.994
Second, from inside the vehicle
to begin programming,
00:00:51.994 --> 00:00:56.797
press the center of the Pro Trailer Backup
Assist button located to the right of
00:00:56.797 --> 00:00:58.569
the steering wheel, here.
00:00:58.569 --> 00:01:02.792
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:02.792 --> 00:01:06.612
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:06.612 --> 00:01:08.489
Press OK once finished.
00:01:08.489 --> 00:01:11.508
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:11.508 --> 00:01:16.095
Electric, which is the default or
surge type and press OK.
00:01:16.095 --> 00:01:18.751
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer.
00:01:18.751 --> 00:01:21.737
Low, which is the recommended setting for
most trailers,
00:01:21.737 --> 00:01:25.892
Medium or High if your trailer requires
more aggressive braking like if you have
00:01:25.892 --> 00:01:29.230
a larger, heavier trailer, for instance.
00:01:29.230 --> 00:01:33.586
And since Pro Trailer Backup Assist is not
currently compatible with fifth-wheel or
00:01:33.586 --> 00:01:37.592
gooseneck type trailers, conventional
will be the default trailer type.
00:01:37.592 --> 00:01:41.507
You'll get a message asking if you
want to add Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: What type of trailers can be used with the Pro Trailer Backup Assist?

video_name: How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.081 --> 00:00:03.902
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.902 --> 00:00:06.147
Your vehicle may be equipped
with power outlets,
00:00:06.147 --> 00:00:09.900
where you can charge devices like laptops,
rechargeable power tools, and more.
00:00:09.900 --> 00:00:12.030
Let me explain.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:14.190
There are two outlets in your vehicle.
00:00:14.190 --> 00:00:18.710
One in the instrument panel, here, and
one in the rear of the center console
00:00:18.710 --> 00:00:21.650
that is easily accessible for
someone in the back seat.
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:25.510
The outlets can charge when your truck is
running ,and can deliver up to 400 watts
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:29.650
when you're parked or idling, and
up to 300 watts when you're driving.
00:00:29.650 --> 00:00:33.970
Keep in mind, when using power tools,
the power outlets are only to be used for
00:00:33.970 --> 00:00:37.600
recharging and
should not be used as a main power source.
00:00:37.600 --> 00:00:38.303
Any questions?
00:00:38.303 --> 00:00:40.149
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:40.149 --> 00:00:50.149
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo_seg1.mp4
question: What should be done when the power outlet shuts down itself?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:00:26.970 --> 00:00:27.820
Don't worry.
00:00:27.820 --> 00:00:29.450
If you'd rather choose when to lock or
00:00:29.450 --> 00:00:33.910
unlock your doors, you can turn off
either or both features at any time.
00:00:33.910 --> 00:00:36.740
First, you'll need to
access programming mode.
00:00:36.740 --> 00:00:37.316
Here's how.
00:00:37.316 --> 00:00:41.015
[MUSIC]
00:00:41.015 --> 00:00:45.980
Turn the car on,
press the car unlock button three times.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:50.945
Turn the car off, press the unlock
button three more times and
00:00:50.945 --> 00:00:52.895
turn the car on again.
00:00:52.895 --> 00:00:56.185
You'll hear a chirp to let you know
you've entered the programming mode.
00:00:56.185 --> 00:00:57.435
Still with me?
00:00:57.435 --> 00:00:58.335
Good.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg3.mp4

video_name: Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs
video_trans:
00:00:45.570 --> 00:00:48.950
There are a few things that you may
need to know to prevent damaging them.
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:51.430
Before you put a jack
underneath your vehicle,
00:00:51.430 --> 00:00:54.790
you'll need to ensure that the power
running boards are turned off.
00:00:54.790 --> 00:00:58.400
Also, when using a jack,
be sure to check your owner's manual for
00:00:58.400 --> 00:01:00.440
proper mounting locations.
00:01:00.440 --> 00:01:04.510
And when using a hoist lift be sure to
place the lift arms under the frame rails
00:01:04.510 --> 00:01:09.130
at all times to avoid damage to the under
body and running board components.
00:01:09.130 --> 00:01:10.250
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using Power-Deployable Running Boards _ Ford How-To _ Ford-PpmFNrvleWs_seg4.mp4
question: How to prevent the vehicle when using the jack?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:15.650 --> 00:00:19.640
Adaptive cruise control maintains
a pre-set gap by adjusting the vehicle's
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:22.250
speed so you don't need to
constantly use your brake and
00:00:22.250 --> 00:00:25.340
accelerator to adjust with
the speed of traffic.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg2.mp4
question: What feature automatically adjusts and maintains the vehicles gap between other vehicles so that you don't have to constantly use your break and accelerator?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:52.860 --> 00:01:54.050
When towing a trailer,
00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308
pressing the Tow/Haul mode button located
at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220
activates the tow/haul feature which will
allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130
to automatically follow at
a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120
This is handy since the extra
weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.

a wall with your headlamps aimed at it.

Pull it, and fold the seat back down.

video_trans:
00:03:05.580 --> 00:03:08.610
To do so, touch the Alert button here.
00:03:08.610 --> 00:03:10.760
Then the Enable Alerts button.

00:01:10.685 --> 00:01:12.305
use the built-in countdown start.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg4.mp4
question: How do you initiate automatic acceleration?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:01:00.980 --> 00:01:04.100
Okay, now I'll quickly discuss
the short strap mentioned earlier.
00:01:04.100 --> 00:01:07.460
To fold the second row seats from
the third row, pull the short strap, and
00:01:07.460 --> 00:01:09.980
the seat back will fold down forward.
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:12.780
Next, pull the longer
strap to unlock the seat.
00:01:12.780 --> 00:01:15.490
Now, push the seat forward and down.
00:01:15.490 --> 00:01:18.690
Your vehicle also has folding floor
support panels that makes stowing
00:01:18.690 --> 00:01:20.150
cargo easier.
00:01:20.150 --> 00:01:20.910
With the second and
00:01:20.910 --> 00:01:25.670
third row seats folded down, grab hold of
the panels and pull to disconnect them.
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:28.740
You may need to give them a little tug
to disengage them from their magnetic
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:29.850
fasteners.
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.910
Then unfold like this.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg3.mp4
question: What strap is pulled to unlock the seat?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:01:09.710 --> 00:01:12.960
And finally, to extend the life
of the bright chrome grill and
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:17.600
other exterior trim parts, wax all
finishes regularly, especially before and
00:01:17.600 --> 00:01:19.050
after the winter season.
00:01:19.050 --> 00:01:22.100
Polishing and waxing can
maintain the finishes luster and
00:01:22.100 --> 00:01:24.580
help eliminate the occurrence
of rust spots.
00:01:24.580 --> 00:01:28.740
For best results, wipe residue off
using a microfiber detailing cloth and
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:30.530
following product directions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg4.mp4
question: How can waxing and polishing help the finishes?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:55.210 --> 00:01:58.981
And when in reverse, you can use the zoom
button on the touch screen to get a closer
00:01:58.981 --> 00:02:00.776
view of what's behind your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg10.mp4
question: What does the Zoom button do when you're in reverse?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:28.460 --> 00:01:32.470
Once conditions are favorable for the
system to work, the lines will turn green.
00:01:32.470 --> 00:01:34.270
This means it's ready to go.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg6.mp4
question: What does it mean when the lines turn green?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:22.590 --> 00:01:26.600
A green bar indicates a positive
effect on your EV range,
00:01:26.600 --> 00:01:29.150
while an amber bar indicates
a negative effect.
00:01:29.150 --> 00:01:32.110
The longer the bar, the larger the impact.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg7.mp4
question: What does the green color represent?

video_name: Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw
video_trans:
00:00:30.999 --> 00:00:35.018
To close all of your windows and
your moon roof, press and
00:00:35.018 --> 00:00:38.295
hold the lock button for
at least two seconds.
00:00:38.295 --> 00:00:41.124
To stop your windows from closing,
00:00:41.124 --> 00:00:45.151
just press the lock or
unlock button on the fob.
00:00:45.151 --> 00:00:46.241
And just so you know,
00:00:46.241 --> 00:00:49.940
the bounce back function is also active
while the windows are closing and
00:00:49.940 --> 00:00:53.655
that helps reduce the worry of something
getting caught in the process.
00:00:53.655 --> 00:00:56.450
Any questions, go to FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Global-Open Windows Feature _ Ford How-To _ Ford-RTxhpkZucWw_seg3.mp4
question: how many seconds will take windows closing

video_name: Center High Mounted Stop Lamp (CHMSL) Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Zbm44fDvSB0
video_trans:
00:00:47.945 --> 00:00:52.325
For added convenience, there's also a LED
cargo light to help illuminate the rear
00:00:52.325 --> 00:00:54.570
area when hitching a trailer at night.
00:00:54.570 --> 00:00:58.196
Just press the button located to
the left of the headlamp control, here,
00:00:58.196 --> 00:00:58.906
to turn it on.
00:00:58.906 --> 00:01:03.220
Or the light button located
in the rear box, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Center High Mounted Stop Lamp (CHMSL) Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Zbm44fDvSB0_seg4.mp4
question: Where is the cargo light button located?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:01:34.270 --> 00:01:36.670
When you see yellow,
the Aid mode is active.
00:01:36.670 --> 00:01:39.550
Then you'll feel the steering wheel move
a little to help direct you to steer
00:01:39.550 --> 00:01:40.350
back into you lane.
00:01:41.510 --> 00:01:43.660
If you see red, the Alert mode is active,
00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:46.030
and you'll feel
the steering wheel vibrate.
00:01:46.030 --> 00:01:48.490
And if you don't see any lines,
the system is off.
00:01:49.660 --> 00:01:50.630
And don't worry.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg7.mp4
question: What mode is active when the steer wheel is vibrating during driving?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:00:28.090 --> 00:00:30.200
When looking at the 360-degree view,
00:00:30.200 --> 00:00:33.180
you'll see dotted yellow lines
on each side of the vehicle.
00:00:33.180 --> 00:00:36.690
These represent the keep-out zone and
let you know where the edges of your
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:40.290
mirror are in relation to what
you're seeing in the camera image.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg3.mp4
question: What do the yellow lines on either side indicate?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:02:03.200 --> 00:02:07.270
Replay allows you to listen to up to 44
minutes of previously cast contents from
00:02:07.270 --> 00:02:08.000
the current channel.
00:02:09.280 --> 00:02:13.060
The system will begin storing
content once a channel is selected.
00:02:13.060 --> 00:02:16.570
To replay a song,
just tape the seek back button once and
00:02:16.570 --> 00:02:18.700
it will jump back to the prior song.
00:02:18.700 --> 00:02:20.290
To jump multiple songs or
00:02:20.290 --> 00:02:24.960
listen to content farther back,
tap the seek back button multiple times.
00:02:24.960 --> 00:02:28.640
To return to real time content,
touch the Replay button again and
00:02:28.640 --> 00:02:31.040
it will bring you back to live audio.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg7.mp4
question: How many minutes of music does replay allow one to listen to?

video_trans:
00:00:21.625 --> 00:00:22.345
To close it,
00:00:22.345 --> 00:00:26.609
press the indent tab firmly and it will
automatically rotate into position.
00:00:26.609 --> 00:00:29.641
You'll know it's locked when
you feel it latch into place.

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:01:04.550 --> 00:01:07.340
There’s also an option that
lets you skip channels or
00:01:07.340 --> 00:01:09.690
lock them out from young listeners.
00:01:09.690 --> 00:01:14.240
From the listing screen, anytime you touch
the skip button next to a specific channel
00:01:14.240 --> 00:01:18.680
or use the seek up and down buttons,
that channel will be automatically skipped
00:01:18.680 --> 00:01:22.640
when manually tuned using the tune up or
tune down buttons.
00:01:22.640 --> 00:01:25.220
Touching the lock button
followed by your PIN number
00:01:25.220 --> 00:01:28.318
will prevent that channel
from being listened to.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg4.mp4
question: Can I block a station?

video_trans:

on towing status like your steering angle,
00:01:26.540 --> 00:01:29.020
information on the specific
trailer that is attached,
00:01:29.020 --> 00:01:32.390
the amount of miles you have on

trailer setup, and checklist to
follow when connecting your trailer.

00:00:08.310 --> 00:00:10.150

It's called Auto Start-Stop technology.
00:00:12.840 --> 00:00:13.530
Let me explain.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop Technology - Ford Cars and SUV's  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h035M-OTo7w_seg1.mp4
question: What is the title of the video above?

video_name: Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.321 --> 00:00:04.941
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.941 --> 00:00:09.051
Your steering wheel can be adjusted to
make driving even more comfortable,
00:00:09.051 --> 00:00:10.370
let me show you how.
00:00:10.370 --> 00:00:12.990
First, make sure you're
comfortable in your seat.
00:00:12.990 --> 00:00:15.550
This will ensure that you're moving
your wheel to the correct position.
00:00:16.730 --> 00:00:20.680
Now, unlock the steering column by
pulling the release lever either down and
00:00:20.680 --> 00:00:24.000
away or down and toward you.
00:00:24.000 --> 00:00:28.730
Move the steering wheel to a good spot for
you by tilting it up or down, or
00:00:28.730 --> 00:00:32.140
by either pulling it toward you or
pushing it away from you.
00:00:33.230 --> 00:00:35.750
Once you have it in the right position,
lock it by
00:00:35.750 --> 00:00:40.410
pushing the same lever you used to unlock
it, only in the opposite direction.
00:00:40.410 --> 00:00:41.590
Any questions?
00:00:41.590 --> 00:00:42.115
Go to
00:00:42.115 --> 00:00:52.115
FordOwner.com.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adjustable Tilt_Telescoping Steering Column _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TlWXbGtYrTQ_seg1.mp4
question: What must you do after you position the steering wheel according to your comfort level?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:27.780
To turn adaptive cruise control on,
press and
00:00:27.780 --> 00:00:30.690
release the on off switch
on your steering wheel.
00:00:30.690 --> 00:00:33.560
The information display will
show a gray indicator light
00:00:33.560 --> 00:00:35.470
as well as the current gap setting.
00:00:35.470 --> 00:00:38.170
Now, accelerate to the speed you want,
00:00:38.170 --> 00:00:40.720
press the set button on your wheel and
release.
00:00:40.720 --> 00:00:43.120
Then take your foot off the accelerator.

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:51.980 --> 00:00:55.130
In addition to being able to personalize
your left side screen choices,
00:00:55.130 --> 00:00:58.734
there are also a few screens that
are only available in MyView.
00:00:58.734 --> 00:01:03.010
Like Accessory Power, which indicates the
electrical power demands being put on your
00:01:03.010 --> 00:01:04.650
vehicle from your climate system, and
00:01:04.650 --> 00:01:08.680
other accessories like your radio,
headlights, and windshield wipers.
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.700
Coolant temp, which indicates if your
engine temperature is normal, or high.
00:01:12.700 --> 00:01:16.550
Keep in mind, whichever two choices you
select, the far right side of the screen
00:01:16.550 --> 00:01:19.540
will always display your fuel gauge and
battery gauge.
00:01:19.540 --> 00:01:20.860
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM_seg3.mp4
question: Where are the fuel gauge and battery gauge always displayed?
