transporting cargo.
00:00:13.800 --> 00:00:15.050
Here's how to do it.
00:00:15.050 --> 00:00:19.640
To fold the second row seats,
first push down the head restraints, like this.
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:24.793
Now, find the strap located on the side of
the seat back closest to the door, here.
00:00:24.793 --> 00:00:26.442
And pull it to fold the seat back down.
00:00:26.442 --> 00:00:28.665
[MUSIC]
00:00:28.665 --> 00:00:32.680
You'll notice that you have two straps on
the seat back, a long one and a short one.
00:00:32.680 --> 00:00:35.050
I'll tell you about the shorter one later.
00:00:35.050 --> 00:00:38.920
So, for now, find the longer strap and
pull up to unlock it.
00:00:38.920 --> 00:00:41.850
Now, move the entire seat forward and
down.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg1.mp4
question: What are the steps to fold the seat?

video_name: Explorer Trailer Hitch Cover Removal _ Ford How-To _ Ford-83YuRtOT7_Q
video_trans:

underneath the center of the panel and
00:00:20.200 --> 00:00:22.040
feel for the recess.
00:00:22.040 --> 00:00:24.830
Now, just lift up and pull out.
00:00:24.830 --> 00:00:28.170
Once the bottom becomes unlatched
from the side of the panel,
00:00:28.170 --> 00:00:31.550
place your fingers behind and
gently pull it off.
00:00:31.550 --> 00:00:32.239
It's that simple.

Adaptive cruise control maintains
a pre-set gap by adjusting the vehicle's
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:22.250
speed so you don't need to
constantly use your brake and
00:00:22.250 --> 00:00:25.340
accelerator to adjust with
the speed of traffic.

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:13.160 --> 00:00:14.870
With your front seats upright, look for
00:00:14.870 --> 00:00:18.560
the storage latch on the bottom
of the middle seat cushion, here.
00:00:18.560 --> 00:00:20.860
Pull the latch to release the seat and
pull it back.
00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg2.mp4

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:02:12.160 --> 00:02:16.400
To unfold the second row seats,
pull the longer strap on the seat back up.
00:02:16.400 --> 00:02:20.020
When you feel it unlock from the floor,
move the entire seat back and
00:02:20.020 --> 00:02:22.690
push down until you feel it
lock into position again.
00:02:22.690 --> 00:02:24.622
And until you hear it click.
00:02:24.622 --> 00:02:27.481
Finally, pull up on the short strap and
flip the seat back up.
00:02:27.481 --> 00:02:30.019
[MUSIC]
00:02:30.019 --> 00:02:31.043
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg5.mp4

the vehicle's rate of acceleration

0 to 30 miles per hour,

00:00:55.305 --> 00:00:57.775

1/8 mile, or 1/4 mile.

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.512
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.512 --> 00:00:08.350
Your vehicle may be equipped with some or
all of these LED lighting features,
00:00:08.350 --> 00:00:12.610
that are both convenient and offer
a little extra security when traveling.
00:00:12.610 --> 00:00:13.270
Let me explain.
00:00:14.320 --> 00:00:17.450
Our quad beam LED head lamps
generate a brighter light,
00:00:17.450 --> 00:00:21.160
that resembles natural daylight,
which in turn can help reduce eye strain.
00:00:21.160 --> 00:00:24.425
Plus, they typically
last longer than halogen.
00:00:24.425 --> 00:00:25.631
Bright LED tail lamps and
00:00:25.631 --> 00:00:30.130
fog lamps compliment the headlamps
while enhancing nighttime visibility.

00:00:19.395 --> 00:00:21.625

video_name: Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0
video_trans:
00:00:14.740 --> 00:00:18.920
The forward collision warning with brake
support, uses a radar sensor to detect
00:00:18.920 --> 00:00:22.445
slower moving vehicles traveling
in the same direction as you and
00:00:22.445 --> 00:00:24.880
warns you if you're
rapidly approaching them.
00:00:24.880 --> 00:00:28.520
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield and
00:00:28.520 --> 00:00:30.110
the warning chime will sound.
00:00:30.110 --> 00:00:33.120
If you don't react after the alert and
continue to get closer to
00:00:33.120 --> 00:00:36.870
the other vehicle, the system will
pre-charge your breaks for rapid breaking.
00:00:36.870 --> 00:00:39.420
So, they can respond faster once
you do press your brake pedal.
00:00:40.470 --> 00:00:43.720
Once your brakes have been pre-charged,
even if you press them lightly,
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:46.300
they'll apply full stopping
power to help stop you quickly.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0_seg2.mp4
question: How does the Forward Collision Warning system alert you?

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.720
When you're ready to fold up the step,
00:00:45.720 --> 00:00:48.550
press the yellow number 1
button on the extender bar and
00:00:48.550 --> 00:00:51.200
guide it down with your hand to allow
it to lower into the black bar.
00:00:52.680 --> 00:00:57.140
Now, press the yellow number 2
button at the base of the bar, here.
00:00:57.140 --> 00:01:00.245
Fold the bar toward you and
push it back into the tailgate.
00:01:00.245 --> 00:01:02.985
Finally, lift the step up
until it's horizontal and
00:01:02.985 --> 00:01:05.045
push it back into
the tailgate until it clicks.
00:01:06.135 --> 00:01:07.080
One more thing.
00:01:07.080 --> 00:01:11.028
Unlike previous models, the tailgate
handle is stored within the tailgate
00:01:11.028 --> 00:01:14.556
itself, so it's flush to the surface and
nothing is sticking out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg3.mp4
question: where is the tailgate handle stored?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:02:18.866 --> 00:02:23.348
To switch between adaptive cruise control
or normal cruise use the 5-way switch on
00:02:23.348 --> 00:02:26.134
your steering wheel and
the information displays.
00:02:26.134 --> 00:02:30.544
Select Driver Assist, Cruise Control,
then select Adaptive to enable,
00:02:30.544 --> 00:02:33.847
or in Normal for
a conventional cruise control system.
00:02:33.847 --> 00:02:36.399
Meaning, it will not
automatically adjust speed,
00:02:36.399 --> 00:02:38.782
based on the speed of
the vehicle in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg9.mp4
question: How do I switch between adaptive or normal cruise control?

First, press the on off switch on
the end of the left hand stock
00:00:17.820 --> 00:00:18.820

00:00:20.540 --> 00:00:24.560
Once it's on, use the five way control
on the left side of your steering wheel
00:00:24.560 --> 00:00:25.900
to choose your settings.
00:00:25.900 --> 00:00:28.330
Select Driver Assist, then Lane Keeping.

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:54.590 --> 00:00:59.120
Once adaptive cruise is on, it uses radar
to constantly scan for slower vehicles in
00:00:59.120 --> 00:01:03.100
front of you and automatically adjust
your speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:03.100 --> 00:01:04.630
You may notice that on occasion,
00:01:04.630 --> 00:01:07.600
you go slower than you
initially set your cruise for.
00:01:07.600 --> 00:01:10.540
But don't worry,
the system is still working.
00:01:10.540 --> 00:01:13.850
Once traffic is cleared,
you'll return to the speed you set.

the front grille that gives you additional
00:00:20.590 --> 00:00:23.670
assistance while you're driving
forward at low speeds by showing you
00:00:23.670 --> 00:00:26.890

video_name: Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-lcsygGhXqk0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.259
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.259 --> 00:00:07.200
Did you know that you can equip
a trailer with a feature that allows
00:00:07.200 --> 00:00:09.876
your vehicle to monitor and
provide a warning if the tires of
00:00:09.876 --> 00:00:13.350
a trailer that you're towing
are significantly underinflated?
00:00:13.350 --> 00:00:14.850
Let me explain.
00:00:14.850 --> 00:00:18.140
If one or more tires of a connected
trailer become underinflated,
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:22.120
the trailer tire pressure monitoring
system, or TPMS, will display
00:00:22.120 --> 00:00:25.670
a pop-up warning in your instrument
display indicating which tire is low.
00:00:26.790 --> 00:00:27.623
Any questions?
00:00:27.623 --> 00:00:29.513
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:29.513 --> 00:00:39.513
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-lcsygGhXqk0_seg1.mp4
question: What will the Trailer Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) do if one or more tires of the connected trailer become undeinflated?

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:31.890
Here, you can change the mode to alert
00:00:31.890 --> 00:00:34.440
which will vibrate your steering
wheel if you start to drift.
00:00:36.040 --> 00:00:39.990
Aid, which uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer the car back
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:40.886
into the target lane.
00:00:40.886 --> 00:00:44.480
Or Alert + Aid which gives
you both sets of cues.
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.870
Unlike when you're in the alert mode,
in the combined mode,
00:00:48.870 --> 00:00:52.520
you won't feel the alert vibration
until you're further out of your lane.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek_seg3.mp4
question: What does the Aid mode do if you start to drift away from your lane?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:02.740 --> 00:01:04.950
Every time that you turn your vehicle off,
and
00:01:04.950 --> 00:01:07.280
you've used plug in
energy during your trip,
00:01:07.280 --> 00:01:10.870
the Next Full Charge screen will appear on
the right side of your instrument cluster.
00:01:10.870 --> 00:01:15.470
It will show your estimated miles per
full charge, just like on the left side,
00:01:15.470 --> 00:01:19.880
plus additional information about how your
energy usage has impacted your estimate
00:01:19.880 --> 00:01:22.590
as compared to the rated
the electric range for your vehicle.

video_name: How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM
video_trans:
00:00:32.110 --> 00:00:36.110
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.110 --> 00:00:39.960
For best results, it's recommended to use
a draw bar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.600
drop to position your trailer level to
the ground. Then line up your vehicle and
00:00:44.600 --> 00:00:47.360
trailer by pulling forward, so
they're in line with one another.
00:00:48.500 --> 00:00:51.994
Second, from inside the vehicle
to begin programming,
00:00:51.994 --> 00:00:56.797
press the center of the Pro Trailer Backup
Assist button located to the right of
00:00:56.797 --> 00:00:58.569
the steering wheel, here.
00:00:58.569 --> 00:01:02.792
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:02.792 --> 00:01:06.612
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:06.612 --> 00:01:08.489
Press OK once finished.
00:01:08.489 --> 00:01:11.508
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:11.508 --> 00:01:16.095
Electric, which is the default or
surge type and press OK.
00:01:16.095 --> 00:01:18.751
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer.
00:01:18.751 --> 00:01:21.737
Low, which is the recommended setting for
most trailers,
00:01:21.737 --> 00:01:25.892
Medium or High if your trailer requires
more aggressive braking like if you have
00:01:25.892 --> 00:01:29.230
a larger, heavier trailer, for instance.
00:01:29.230 --> 00:01:33.586
And since Pro Trailer Backup Assist is not
currently compatible with fifth-wheel or
00:01:33.586 --> 00:01:37.592
gooseneck type trailers, conventional
will be the default trailer type.
00:01:37.592 --> 00:01:41.507
You'll get a message asking if you
want to add Pro Trailer Backup Assist.
00:01:41.507 --> 00:01:43.224
Select Yes to confirm.
00:01:43.224 --> 00:01:45.864
A prompt will direct you
to straighten the trailer,
00:01:45.864 --> 00:01:47.725
if necessary to continue the setup.
00:01:47.725 --> 00:01:51.208
You'll then get another message directing
you to put the vehicle in park and
00:01:51.208 --> 00:01:54.810
to place the Pro Trailer Backup Assist
target sticker on your trailer tongue.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Set Up Pro Trailer Backup Assist  _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oeF7w7ngcYM_seg3.mp4
question: How do you connect your truck to the trailer?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:01:09.710 --> 00:01:12.960
And finally, to extend the life
of the bright chrome grill and
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:17.600
other exterior trim parts, wax all
finishes regularly, especially before and
00:01:17.600 --> 00:01:19.050
after the winter season.
00:01:19.050 --> 00:01:22.100
Polishing and waxing can
maintain the finishes luster and
00:01:22.100 --> 00:01:24.580
help eliminate the occurrence
of rust spots.
00:01:24.580 --> 00:01:28.740
For best results, wipe residue off
using a microfiber detailing cloth and
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:30.530
following product directions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg4.mp4
question: How do you extend the life of the chrome grill?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:00:15.740 --> 00:00:19.560
First press the lock button on your
key fob to lock all the doors.
00:00:20.620 --> 00:00:24.120
Then press the remote start button,
the one with the 2x icon two times.
00:00:24.120 --> 00:00:29.300
Your outside lights will flash twice and
then your car will start.
00:00:30.490 --> 00:00:31.340
For some vehicles,
00:00:31.340 --> 00:00:35.225
a light on your your remote will also let
you know if your car has started or not.
00:00:35.225 --> 00:00:37.235
Pretty convenient, right?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg2.mp4
question: What visual signal does the vehicle provide to indicate that remote starting has been requested?

00:01:23.410 --> 00:01:25.960
augments transmission operation

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
00:00:42.860 --> 00:00:46.486
However, if your light flashes rapidly and
then turns to a constant light,
00:00:46.486 --> 00:00:49.273
you're not done yet and
will have to take few extra steps.
00:00:49.273 --> 00:00:50.899
[MUSIC]
00:00:50.899 --> 00:00:52.750
Don't worry, I'll walk you through them.
00:00:52.750 --> 00:00:55.032
You'll need to complete the next
few steps in 30 seconds, so
00:00:55.032 --> 00:00:57.542
you might want to have someone help
you if you think it would be easier.
00:00:57.542 --> 00:00:59.260
[MUSIC]
00:00:59.260 --> 00:01:03.500
First, press and hold the learn button
on your garage door opener motor, here.
00:01:04.900 --> 00:01:07.170
Next, get back in your car and press and
00:01:07.170 --> 00:01:11.360
hold the selected function button on your
HomeLink for two seconds then release it.
00:01:11.360 --> 00:01:14.500
Then press and hold it for
two seconds again and release it.

00:00:32.005 --> 00:00:34.115

00:00:39.003 --> 00:00:41.945
Max A/C and Max Defrost buttons.

video_trans:
00:00:43.660 --> 00:00:44.710
Still with me?

In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:49.210 --> 00:00:52.970

00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:56.120
To get there, use the five-way

00:00:56.120 --> 00:00:58.180

00:01:02.810 --> 00:01:04.940
This is what we talked about earlier.
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:08.170
And the progress bar that lights up to
show you the amount of power going to
00:01:08.170 --> 00:01:11.000
the trailer brakes when you're
foot is on the brake pedal.
00:01:11.000 --> 00:01:15.390
Unless a trailer is connected,
the display will read no trailer detected.

video_name: Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.603
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.603 --> 00:00:06.620
To help avoid damaging
your transmission and
00:00:06.620 --> 00:00:08.691
to help provide a better
driving experience,
00:00:08.691 --> 00:00:12.640
there are a few things you should know
about proper clutch pedal operation.
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.215
Let me explain.
00:00:14.215 --> 00:00:18.445
The manual transmission in your vehicle
has six gears along with a reverse gear.
00:00:18.445 --> 00:00:22.265
When starting your vehicle, make sure that
your clutch pedal is fully depressed.
00:00:22.265 --> 00:00:25.575
In order for your transmission and
clutch to function at it's best,
00:00:25.575 --> 00:00:29.520
you need to press the clutch pedal all
the way to the floor before every shift.
00:00:29.520 --> 00:00:32.440
Then slowly release it while
pressing the accelerator.
00:00:32.440 --> 00:00:35.280
Not pressing the clutch pedal fully
between shifts can damage your
00:00:35.280 --> 00:00:40.780
transmission, and you may experience
a grinding sound, rapid jerking motion,
00:00:40.780 --> 00:00:44.400
or the car may stall if the clutch
is not properly engaged.
00:00:44.400 --> 00:00:46.080
And here's another thing you should know.
00:00:46.080 --> 00:00:48.920
Don't drive with your foot
resting on the clutch pedal, or
00:00:48.920 --> 00:00:52.230
use it to hold your vehicle at
a standstill while waiting on a hill.
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:55.670
Doing so may overheat the clutch and
prematurely wear it out.
00:00:55.670 --> 00:00:58.548
This could nullify
a clutch warranty claim.
00:00:58.548 --> 00:00:59.583
Any questions?
00:00:59.583 --> 00:01:02.556
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:01:02.556 --> 00:01:12.556
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Proper Clutch Pedal Operation _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GW_gOBEPCYE_seg1.mp4
question: What is the proper way to operate a clutch pedal?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:52.500
To use Launch Control, select Launch
Control under the Track App menu.
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.105
Once enabled quickly press
the accelerator all the way to the floor.
00:00:56.105 --> 00:00:58.365
The feature will automatically
set your preferred RPM.
00:00:58.365 --> 00:01:01.535
You'll know it's set when you see
the set icon in the lower right
00:01:01.535 --> 00:01:02.795
corner of the display.
00:01:02.795 --> 00:01:03.296
When ready,
00:01:03.296 --> 00:01:06.265
quickly release the clutch while
maintaining pressure on the accelerator.
00:01:06.265 --> 00:01:08.252
[MUSIC]
00:01:08.252 --> 00:01:09.580
One more thing.
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.110
You can turn it off by
following the same steps.
00:01:12.110 --> 00:01:14.220
Simply select Launch Control and press OK.

question: How do I use Launch Control?

video_name: SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw
video_trans:
00:01:45.930 --> 00:01:50.082
To set valet mode, which locks out the
SYNC 3 screen to the valet attendant while
00:01:50.082 --> 00:01:52.920
driving your car, press the Valet tile.
00:01:52.920 --> 00:01:56.440
You get a message asking you to enter
a personal identification number of your
00:01:56.440 --> 00:01:58.750
choice and if you want to continue.
00:01:58.750 --> 00:02:00.580
If so, press Yes.
00:02:00.580 --> 00:02:02.867
Then type in your PIN and press Done.
00:02:02.867 --> 00:02:05.810
Re-enter the PIN to complete the process.
00:02:05.810 --> 00:02:07.980
Once you get your key back from the valet,
00:02:07.980 --> 00:02:11.890
you need to enter the PIN again to turn
Valet Mode off and unlock the screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 Overview - Customizable Settings _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-4c3WN1usCGw_seg7.mp4
question: How do I turn valet mode on and off?

video_trans:

To fold your third row manual seats flat,
or
00:01:32.390 --> 00:01:36.190

then fold your head restraints down by
00:01:36.190 --> 00:01:39.970

seat back, just below the head restraint.
00:01:39.970 --> 00:01:42.570
Next, fold the seat back
down by pulling and
00:01:42.570 --> 00:01:45.969
holding the number 1 strap, while
you're pushing the seat back forward.
00:01:47.330 --> 00:01:49.870
Once it starts to fold,
let go of the strap.

speed so you don't need to

00:00:22.250 --> 00:00:25.340
accelerator to adjust with
the speed of traffic.

The Search channels using voice command,

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:39.684 --> 00:00:43.216
The jack handle and lug wrench are located
in a storage compartment in the side of
00:00:43.216 --> 00:00:46.160
the passenger seat base, by the step well.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:49.460
Just put your fingers under
the two slots and pull it open.
00:00:49.460 --> 00:00:52.100
The six-piece jack handle
is inside a pouch,
00:00:52.100 --> 00:00:54.360
simply unsnap the three
straps to remove it.
00:00:55.560 --> 00:00:59.872
Now assemble the jack handle by inserting
the male end with the locking button into
00:00:59.872 --> 00:01:03.017
the tube, making sure it lines up and
snaps into position.
00:01:03.017 --> 00:01:05.545
Do the same with the remaining pieces.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg3.mp4
question: Are the pieces of the jack handles numbered so you can make sure it is connected properly?

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:29.339
To use line lock, using the five-way
switch scroll down to Track Apps.
00:00:29.339 --> 00:00:31.210
And select Line Lock from the menu.
00:00:31.210 --> 00:00:33.860
There are two steps to using Line Lock.
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:36.660
This step verifies the driver and
car are ready.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:38.670
Simply follow the prompts on the screen.
00:00:38.670 --> 00:00:41.130
If you're unable to select Line Lock,
00:00:41.130 --> 00:00:43.570
check to be sure you're driving
under 25 miles an hour,
00:00:43.570 --> 00:00:49.060
the vehicle is on a level surface, and
you're not in another driving mode.
00:00:49.060 --> 00:00:54.370
To engage, firmly press and hold the
brakes, press OK on the steering wheel,
00:00:54.370 --> 00:00:57.980
remove your foot from the brake pedal,
and hit the accelerator.
00:00:57.980 --> 00:01:02.422
A 15 second countdown timer will
show the remaining time left before
00:01:02.422 --> 00:01:03.785
Line Lock shuts off.
00:01:03.785 --> 00:01:06.480
[MUSIC]
00:01:06.480 --> 00:01:10.670
You can always manually cancel it
by pressing the OK button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg2.mp4
question: What are the steps in setting up a line lock and releasing it?

video_name: USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c
video_trans:
00:00:25.360 --> 00:00:29.640
Unlike traditional USB charging ports
that provide 500 milliamps of power and
00:00:29.640 --> 00:00:31.060
can only charge a smartphone or
00:00:31.060 --> 00:00:35.260
media player, smart USB chargers can
provide up to two amps, and know just
00:00:35.260 --> 00:00:38.080
the right amount of power to deliver
to whatever device you're charging.
00:00:39.120 --> 00:00:42.743
Meaning, if you have one device plugged
in that needs two amps to charge, and
00:00:42.743 --> 00:00:46.255
another plugged in at the same time
that only needs one amp to fully charge,
00:00:46.255 --> 00:00:49.029
your smart USB port will deliver
the right amount to both.
00:00:49.029 --> 00:00:52.292
And that can help save battery power for
your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/USB Smart Charging _ Ford How-To _ Ford-p5P3bNlMr0c_seg3.mp4
question: what is the cost of cabel?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:00:13.870 --> 00:00:17.290
To maintain the appearance of
the bright chrome exterior finishes,
00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:19.620
regular cleaning is highly recommended.
00:00:19.620 --> 00:00:24.440
To clean, use water and a mild liquid
automotive soap from an auto supply store.
00:00:24.440 --> 00:00:28.590
Or a 50/50 solution of water and
white vinegar also works well.
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:33.411
And remove all excess water as hard water
spots can deposit iron which can lead
00:00:33.411 --> 00:00:34.013
to rust.
00:00:34.013 --> 00:00:35.947
To remove tar and bugs from the grill,
00:00:35.947 --> 00:00:39.720
it's recommended to use
an oil-based bug and tar remover.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.220
In extreme winter climates, be sure
to rinse away salt residue as soon as
00:00:43.220 --> 00:00:47.070
possible as salt contains chlorides
that can damage the surface finish.
00:00:48.570 --> 00:00:51.750
Avoid all cleaning products that
contain ammonia, bleach, and
00:00:51.750 --> 00:00:54.600
alcohol as they may
also damage the finish.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg2.mp4
question: What kind of products should you avoid in order to prevent damage to the finish of the vehicle?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:02:03.200 --> 00:02:07.270
Replay allows you to listen to up to 44
minutes of previously cast contents from
00:02:07.270 --> 00:02:08.000
the current channel.
00:02:09.280 --> 00:02:13.060
The system will begin storing
content once a channel is selected.
00:02:13.060 --> 00:02:16.570
To replay a song,
just tape the seek back button once and
00:02:16.570 --> 00:02:18.700
it will jump back to the prior song.
00:02:18.700 --> 00:02:20.290
To jump multiple songs or
00:02:20.290 --> 00:02:24.960
listen to content farther back,
tap the seek back button multiple times.
00:02:24.960 --> 00:02:28.640
To return to real time content,
touch the Replay button again and
00:02:28.640 --> 00:02:31.040
it will bring you back to live audio.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg7.mp4
question: How many content can you listen to?

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:57.110 --> 00:01:01.446
Compared to a four or five speed,
the six speed SelectShift transmission,
00:01:01.446 --> 00:01:06.121
gives you greater acceleration from a dead
stop, in first and second gear, while
00:01:06.121 --> 00:01:10.486
higher gears give you better efficiency
with lower RPMs at highway speeds.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc_seg5.mp4

 To toggle through the different gauge

video_name: Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog
video_trans:
00:00:11.850 --> 00:00:15.020
To use the step, first lower the tailgate,
00:00:15.020 --> 00:00:18.950
then press the black release button in
the center of the step molding, here.
00:00:18.950 --> 00:00:20.470
The step will pop out a little, so
00:00:20.470 --> 00:00:23.360
just pull it all the way until it
gently falls into a lower position.
00:00:24.710 --> 00:00:27.860
Next, grab the yellow bar
top to the left of the step.
00:00:27.860 --> 00:00:30.410
Pull until the black bar
is fully extended and
00:00:30.410 --> 00:00:32.920
lift it up until it's locked into place.
00:00:32.920 --> 00:00:35.280
Then, pull the chrome interior
bar all of the way up.
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:39.410
You'll know the bar is fully
extended when you hear a click.
00:00:39.410 --> 00:00:42.930
The bar can be used as a grab handle to
help pull yourself up into the truck bed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Tailgate Step _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0lRdig2hlog_seg2.mp4
question: How do you get the step in the back of the Ford F150 ready for use?

video_name: Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk
video_trans:
00:00:14.430 --> 00:00:17.520
To open your lift gate,
simply kick your leg forward and
00:00:17.520 --> 00:00:21.310
back under the center of the rear
bumper below the license plate.
00:00:21.310 --> 00:00:23.850
Then step back to give
the gate space to open.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk_seg2.mp4
question: What should you do after kicking your leg forward and back under the rear bumper?

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:46.465 --> 00:00:50.790
When a trailer is properly connected and
driving over five miles per hour, BLIS
00:00:50.790 --> 00:00:55.270
with trailer coverage uses sensors in the
vehicle's tail end to extend the detection
00:00:55.270 --> 00:00:59.300
area rearward from the vehicle's side
mirrors to the end of the trailer.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg4.mp4
question: What is the detection are of sensors connected with trailer?

video_name: Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc
video_trans:
00:00:11.450 --> 00:00:13.100
Using the information display, and
00:00:13.100 --> 00:00:16.150
the five way control switch on
the left side of your steering wheel,
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:19.500
you can choose whether you want
your running lamps on or off.
00:00:19.500 --> 00:00:24.380
Just scroll to Settings, Vehicle,
Lighting, then Daytime Lights.
00:00:24.380 --> 00:00:26.750
If you have your daytime
running lamps set to on and
00:00:26.750 --> 00:00:30.430
want to use them, turn the lighting
control to the auto lamp position.
00:00:30.430 --> 00:00:34.110
When the lighting control is in auto lamp
position, and the head lamps are off,
00:00:34.110 --> 00:00:37.099
the daytime running lamps will turn
on automatically when you're driving.
00:00:38.530 --> 00:00:41.770
And will switch between daytime
running lamps and headlamps as needed.
00:00:41.770 --> 00:00:45.150
Based on how light or dark it is outside,
and whether or not the wipers are on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc_seg2.mp4
question: How do I change running day lights to night light mode?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:02:29.300 --> 00:02:32.130
Your vehicle also has fresh air mode.
00:02:32.130 --> 00:02:36.276
To select it, select the panel air
distribution mode, turn the temperature
00:02:36.276 --> 00:02:40.610
dial to the coolest setting, select a fan
speed, press the A/C button to turn it
00:02:40.610 --> 00:02:44.400
off, and make sure that the recirculation
light is not illuminated.
00:02:45.760 --> 00:02:46.700

video_name: Reverse Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Y33ztmJemJ0
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.216
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.216 --> 00:00:06.520
Did you know that your vehicle can
sense when something is behind you?
00:00:06.520 --> 00:00:10.020
It can, thanks to an available
reverse sensing system.
00:00:10.020 --> 00:00:11.940
Let me show you how it works.
00:00:11.940 --> 00:00:16.397
If your vehicle is in reverse, like when
you're backing out of or into a parking
00:00:16.397 --> 00:00:20.454
spot or garage, the reverse sensing
uses sensors on the rear bumpers and
00:00:20.454 --> 00:00:23.804
a warning sound to let you know
if something's behind you.
00:00:23.804 --> 00:00:27.069
If you have both forward and
reverse sensing, sensors on the front and
00:00:27.069 --> 00:00:30.450
back of your vehicle will detect
objects when you're in reverse.
00:00:30.450 --> 00:00:33.392
This is really helpful when you're
parallel parking since your front bumper
00:00:33.392 --> 00:00:34.669
swings when you're backing up.
00:00:34.669 --> 00:00:36.614
[MUSIC]
00:00:36.614 --> 00:00:41.960
And one more thing, the sensors have to be
clear of snow, ice, or mud to work right.
00:00:41.960 --> 00:00:46.220
So make sure to check them periodically
and be aware that outside conditions or
00:00:46.220 --> 00:00:48.690
noises may also trigger the system.
00:00:48.690 --> 00:00:49.800
Any questions?
00:00:49.800 --> 00:00:51.377
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:51.377 --> 00:01:01.377
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Sensing System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Y33ztmJemJ0_seg1.mp4
question: What are thr main specialities of the car?

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:01:06.450 --> 00:01:10.310
If at any time the battery in your remote
dies or the signal is interrupted,
00:01:10.310 --> 00:01:14.320
you can use the removable key
inside to unlock the driver's door.
00:01:14.320 --> 00:01:16.110
Just press the button and
slide the key out.
00:01:17.180 --> 00:01:19.920
Next, insert the key into the slot located
00:01:19.920 --> 00:01:22.440
underneath the rear of
the driver's door handle and
00:01:22.440 --> 00:01:26.320
push up until you feel the internal
tab flex and unlock the plastic bezel.
00:01:27.520 --> 00:01:30.560
Slide the bezel back to
completely remove it.
00:01:30.560 --> 00:01:35.220
When you do, you'll be able to access
the key cylinder and unlock your door.
00:01:35.220 --> 00:01:36.350
To replace the bezel,
00:01:36.350 --> 00:01:39.410
slide it forward until you feel
it snap into the locked position.
00:01:40.650 --> 00:01:44.537
Once you're in, there's a pocket in the
center console made just for the key fob.
00:01:44.537 --> 00:01:46.680
It'll allow you to start your car.
00:01:46.680 --> 00:01:49.860
Place the key fob in the slot
with the button's facing up and
00:01:49.860 --> 00:01:52.810
the unlock button towards
the front of the vehicle.
00:01:52.810 --> 00:01:56.695
Keep in mind, because the key is
programmed to your car, if you lose it,
00:01:56.695 --> 00:01:59.050
you'll need to contact your dealer for
a replacement.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c_seg6.mp4
question: Which side of the fob needs to point up when I place it in the special area in the center console to start the car?

Here are a few more things you'll
need to know when using the feature.
00:01:20.350 --> 00:01:24.990
After setting up and selecting a trailer,
the display always shows you a small top
00:01:24.990 --> 00:01:27.910
view representation of your truck and

00:01:27.910 --> 00:01:30.570

00:01:30.570 --> 00:01:34.766

00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:40.420

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:59.300 --> 00:01:02.040
To set the blind spot
detection on a trailer,
00:01:02.040 --> 00:01:06.000
use the five way switch on your steering
wheel and select type of trailer.
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:09.920
Keep in mind, BLIS only supports
conventional-type trailers.
00:01:09.920 --> 00:01:12.764
Other types selected with
automatically turn off the BLIS and
00:01:12.764 --> 00:01:14.700
cross-traffic alert feature.
00:01:14.700 --> 00:01:17.980
Next, you'll be asked if you want
to set up BLIS with a trailer.
00:01:17.980 --> 00:01:20.010
If no, BLIS turns off.
00:01:20.010 --> 00:01:24.960
If yes, you'll be asked if the trailer is
less than nine feet wide and 33 feet long.
00:01:24.960 --> 00:01:26.720
Now, enter length of trailer,
00:01:26.720 --> 00:01:29.890
which is the length of the hitch
bulb to the end of the trailer.
00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:34.230
You do so by toggling up or down,
using the menu buttons to increase or
00:01:34.230 --> 00:01:36.560
decrease the measurement by three feet.
00:01:36.560 --> 00:01:38.790
You'll need to select
the length that is equal to or
00:01:38.790 --> 00:01:43.070
greater than three feet of the actual
trailer to allow for full coverage.
00:01:43.070 --> 00:01:49.240
For example, if the actual measured length
is 25 feet, input the length to 27 feet.
00:01:49.240 --> 00:01:52.290
Once the length has been entered,
the setup is saved.
00:01:52.290 --> 00:01:54.570
If the trailer has been connected but
no information for
00:01:54.570 --> 00:01:58.890
that trailer has been entered, the system
will ask for trailer information.
00:01:58.890 --> 00:02:03.250
If no trailer information is entered, BLIS
and cross-traffic alert will be disabled.
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:07.620
It's important to remember that if you
select a trailer in the display screen
00:02:07.620 --> 00:02:11.790
prior to connecting the trailer, the
system will load that configuration, and
00:02:11.790 --> 00:02:14.560
you'll get a message in the instrument
cluster when the trailer is connected.
00:02:16.000 --> 00:02:19.592
Correct trailer information must be
stored under towing information for
00:02:19.592 --> 00:02:22.695
BLIS with trailer blind spot
coverage to be active while towing.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg5.mp4
question: How do we set the blind spot for a trailer?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4
question: What feature will help with my steering?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.655
In order to convert the 40 amp
relays to key off battery use,
00:00:48.655 --> 00:00:50.565
there are a few steps you'll need to take.
00:00:50.565 --> 00:00:53.995
First, you'll need to locate
the relay box under the engine hood,
00:00:53.995 --> 00:00:56.015
next to the driver side fender, here.
00:00:57.115 --> 00:01:00.950
Then remove the relay cover by
pressing the tab and lifting it off.
00:01:00.950 --> 00:01:03.060
Next, locate the five amp fuse.
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.900
You'll then need to pull it out,
slide the spacer over, and place it so
00:01:07.900 --> 00:01:12.740
the left prong is in the far left slot and
the right prong is in the middle slot.
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:16.900
Replace the cover and your 40 amp circuits
are now set to run on battery power
00:01:16.900 --> 00:01:18.930
even with the key out of the truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg4.mp4
question: what does moving the 5 amp fuse do?

video_name: What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I
video_trans:
00:00:38.005 --> 00:00:41.420
To adjust the auto lamp time delay,
or how long your head lamps
00:00:41.420 --> 00:00:46.290
stay on after you've turned off your car,
use the information display controls.
00:00:46.290 --> 00:00:51.210
Press the down arrow to find settings,
then press OK and the right arrow.
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:55.520
And scroll down to vehicle, or
convenience depending on your vehicle.
00:00:55.520 --> 00:00:59.370
Next, press the right arrow and
scroll to auto lamp delay.
00:00:59.370 --> 00:01:03.880
Press the right arrow again,
select off or the time delay you wish.
00:01:03.880 --> 00:01:05.350
Then press OK to set it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I_seg3.mp4
question: What controls should you use to adjust the Autolamp Time Delay?

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
00:01:22.760 --> 00:01:26.507
Finally, a helpful table gate lamp
offers lighting for the hitch area
00:01:26.507 --> 00:01:28.385
for easy trailer hook ups at night.
00:01:28.385 --> 00:01:33.193
To turn it on, use the same button you
used to turn on the box interior lights.
00:01:33.193 --> 00:01:34.274
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk_seg5.mp4
question: how do you turn the tailgate light on?

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:00:49.040 --> 00:00:52.840
Normal, which is the default mode, and
gives you an engaging driver experience
00:00:52.840 --> 00:00:55.210
with a comfortable, controlled ride and
confident handling.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI_seg4.mp4
question: What is the default mode?

video_name: 8' Productivity Screen _ Ford How-To _ Ford-apfpV4zPyrc
video_trans:
00:00:57.200 --> 00:01:00.296
Trip fuel gives you trip one and
trip two odometers.
00:01:00.296 --> 00:01:02.722
Fuel economy and history, a compass,
00:01:02.722 --> 00:01:06.851
navigation with turn by turn
directions if a route is set and more.
00:01:06.851 --> 00:01:10.262
As well as truck information which allows
you to view your gauge selection and
00:01:10.262 --> 00:01:14.080
swap your view of transmission
temperature, with turbo boost.
00:01:14.080 --> 00:01:16.440
It also shows tire pressure for
each wheel,
00:01:16.440 --> 00:01:22.280
digital speedometer, engine info like oil
life percentage, and your MyKey Status.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/8' Productivity Screen _ Ford How-To _ Ford-apfpV4zPyrc_seg5.mp4
question: How do I access turn by turn directions?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:00:11.300 --> 00:00:15.100
The power button located in the upper
left corner of the function control panel
00:00:15.100 --> 00:00:17.050
turns your climate system on.
00:00:17.050 --> 00:00:21.020
You also have fan speed controls,
a recirculated air button
00:00:21.020 --> 00:00:25.320
that let's you switch between outside air
and air circulated within the vehicle.
00:00:25.320 --> 00:00:28.990
A distribution control that allows you to
choose whether you want the air flow to
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.005
come through the instrument panel vents,
floor vents or
00:00:32.005 --> 00:00:34.115
through the defrost vent at
the base of the wind shield.
00:00:35.205 --> 00:00:39.003
You'll also find an A/C button,
a rear defrost button and
00:00:39.003 --> 00:00:41.945
Max A/C and Max Defrost buttons.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the Air conditioning button located?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:00.295 --> 00:01:03.545
If you plan on towing a trailer or
boat for example, you'll need to
00:01:03.545 --> 00:01:08.390
activate the tow/haul feature by pressing
the button on the gear shift lever, here.
00:01:08.390 --> 00:01:11.540
The Tow Haul indicator will
illuminate in the instrument cluster,
00:01:11.540 --> 00:01:14.470
indicating that tow/haul
mode is now activated.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:17.518
To deactivate,
simply press the button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg3.mp4
question: How do you activate the tow/haul feature ?

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:01:27.455 --> 00:01:31.757
Adaptive cruise control helps keep
a preset distance when in cruise control,
00:01:31.757 --> 00:01:35.994
plus when used in conjunction with tow
haul mode, it will increase the follow
00:01:35.994 --> 00:01:39.921
distance slightly to compensate for
more braking distance if needed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg6.mp4
question: what mode increase the follow distance slighty?

video_trans:
WEBVTT

Your vehicle may be equipped with
a convenient camera that can be
00:00:07.496 --> 00:00:10.000
helpful when hooking up a trailer and
more.

Let me explain.

video_name: EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI
video_trans:
00:00:41.700 --> 00:00:45.715
One more thing: vehicles equipped with
EcoSelect will also get the benefits of
00:00:45.715 --> 00:00:49.360
EcoCruise, which helps maximize economy
while driving on hilly roadways,
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:52.974
where the vehicle may temporarily lose a
small amount of speed while going uphill.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI_seg3.mp4
question: What other benefit do vehicles equipped with EcoSelect get?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4
question: What benefit does Adaptive Steering with Tow Haul Mode provide?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:00:49.240 --> 00:00:51.890
Remote start is especially nice
when you want to cool off your
00:00:51.890 --> 00:00:53.670
car before getting in on a hot day.
00:00:54.880 --> 00:00:58.590
In fact, if your car has automatic
climate control it will actually
00:00:58.590 --> 00:01:02.520
gauge the temperature inside the car and
adjust it to a more comfortable setting.
00:01:02.520 --> 00:01:06.340
This means that your heated seats,
steering wheel, and
00:01:06.340 --> 00:01:10.090
defrost will turn on on colder days and
your air conditioning and
00:01:10.090 --> 00:01:11.960
cooled seats will turn
on when it is warm out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg4.mp4
question: What happens if my car has Automatic Climate Control, as well as a remote start?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:00:38.950 --> 00:00:43.280
Miles per charge is an estimate of your
EV range with a fully charged battery.
00:00:43.280 --> 00:00:45.940
This estimate is based on your
energy usage while driving.
00:00:47.180 --> 00:00:49.740
Energy usage is affected
by your driving style and
00:00:49.740 --> 00:00:54.680
route, climate control use,
outside temperature and other factors.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg4.mp4
question: what is miles full charge?

video_trans:
00:02:05.218 --> 00:02:09.733
And finally, smart trailer tow connector
informs you of trailer connectivity
00:02:09.733 --> 00:02:13.653
issues, such as burned out lights,
and trailer battery problems.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg9.mp4
question: How do you know that you have trailer battery problems with this car model?

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:13.280 --> 00:00:14.500
For your convenience,
00:00:14.500 --> 00:00:19.130
built in upfitter switches have been moved
to the overhead console for easy access.
00:00:19.130 --> 00:00:23.000
Plus, we've increased the number
of switches from four to six.
00:00:23.000 --> 00:00:27.292
So now, you have more capability to
control components, such as winches,
00:00:27.292 --> 00:00:29.580
electric spreaders, lights and more.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs_seg2.mp4
question: How many switches are there?

video_name: SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0
video_trans:
00:00:20.990 --> 00:00:22.920
In an addition to
the traditional gear selections,
00:00:22.920 --> 00:00:26.330
your transmission has
two additional modes.
00:00:26.330 --> 00:00:28.990
Progressive range selection
that lets you lock out
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:32.690
upper gears when the truck is heavily
loaded or when towing on grades.
00:00:32.690 --> 00:00:35.750
And manual,
that lets you manually select gears.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SelectShift Automatic Transmission   Truck _ Ford How-To _ Ford-P5xyDww1ks0_seg2.mp4
question: What are the two transmission modes?

video_name: Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg
video_trans:
00:00:18.830 --> 00:00:19.730
To access it,
00:00:19.730 --> 00:00:24.040
from the home screen touch Apps on your
SYNC 3 touch screen, then Power Flow.
00:00:25.080 --> 00:00:26.710
The power flow screen will appear and
00:00:26.710 --> 00:00:29.240
you'll see your vehicles
current operating status.
00:00:29.240 --> 00:00:36.020
Either idle, hybrid drive, electric
drive or charging high voltage battery.
00:00:36.020 --> 00:00:38.620
Now depending on which status
you're currently running in
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:41.320
such as electric drive mode
when the engine is off
00:00:41.320 --> 00:00:45.730
you'll see a blue power flow path
indicating which components are in use.
00:00:45.730 --> 00:00:49.360
In this case power from the battery
is being used for accessories like
00:00:49.360 --> 00:00:54.060
the climate control, high voltage electric
heater or air conditioning compressor and
00:00:54.060 --> 00:00:58.500
other low voltage accessories such
as the radio, fans or heated seats.
00:00:58.500 --> 00:01:01.090
You'll also notice power
flowing to the electric motor
00:01:01.090 --> 00:01:02.720
which is driving the wheels.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Power Flow Status with Available SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pl3BAUAi2jg_seg2.mp4
question: How do you access the power flow feature?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:01:49.340 --> 00:01:54.030
Keep in mind, the charge port light
illumination will time out after 1 minute.
00:01:54.030 --> 00:01:57.439
If a fault is detected at any time,
all the lights will flash continuously.
00:01:58.760 --> 00:02:02.930
And if the charge scheduled for later,
the number of lights which represents your
00:02:02.930 --> 00:02:06.140
current minimum state of
charge will be solidly lit.
00:02:06.140 --> 00:02:08.550
And the charge port lights
will timeout after one minute.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg6.mp4
question: What indicates a fault being detected?

video_name: Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo
video_trans:
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:29.339
To use line lock, using the five-way
switch scroll down to Track Apps.
00:00:29.339 --> 00:00:31.210
And select Line Lock from the menu.
00:00:31.210 --> 00:00:33.860
There are two steps to using Line Lock.
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:36.660
This step verifies the driver and
car are ready.
00:00:36.660 --> 00:00:38.670
Simply follow the prompts on the screen.
00:00:38.670 --> 00:00:41.130
If you're unable to select Line Lock,
00:00:41.130 --> 00:00:43.570
check to be sure you're driving
under 25 miles an hour,
00:00:43.570 --> 00:00:49.060
the vehicle is on a level surface, and
you're not in another driving mode.
00:00:49.060 --> 00:00:54.370
To engage, firmly press and hold the
brakes, press OK on the steering wheel,
00:00:54.370 --> 00:00:57.980
remove your foot from the brake pedal,
and hit the accelerator.
00:00:57.980 --> 00:01:02.422
A 15 second countdown timer will
show the remaining time left before
00:01:02.422 --> 00:01:03.785
Line Lock shuts off.
00:01:03.785 --> 00:01:06.480
[MUSIC]
00:01:06.480 --> 00:01:10.670
You can always manually cancel it
by pressing the OK button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Line Lock _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vs7uPnHEvAo_seg2.mp4
question: how do you manually cancel line lock?

video_name: F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ
video_trans:
00:01:04.710 --> 00:01:07.320
Now, let me tell you about some of
the other trailering technology.
00:01:08.380 --> 00:01:12.240
A factory installed integrated trailer
brake controller synchronizes your truck
00:01:12.240 --> 00:01:14.820
brakes with the electric brakes
on your trailer for smoother and
00:01:14.820 --> 00:01:15.840
more effective braking.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg5.mp4
question: How do I get smoother trailer breaking?

video_name: 180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc
video_trans:
00:01:19.380 --> 00:01:22.640
In addition, you'll notice that several
lines appear in the display while
00:01:22.640 --> 00:01:23.980
you're backing up.
00:01:23.980 --> 00:01:26.620
The colored guidelines,
the ones that are not moving,
00:01:26.620 --> 00:01:30.730
show you the actual path your car is going
in while reversing in a straight line.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/180 Camera with Split-View Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0znZlttKkuc_seg6.mp4
question: What appears in the display while you are backing up?

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:03:34.680 --> 00:03:38.160
Okay, now, I'm going to tell you how to input
the measurements into the systems
00:03:38.165 --> 00:03:42.200
information display using
the five-way steering wheel controls.
00:03:42.200 --> 00:03:46.380
To input the measurements you recorded
outside of the vehicle, use the up and
00:03:46.380 --> 00:03:49.900
down arrows on the five-way switch on
the left side of the steering wheel
00:03:49.900 --> 00:03:53.960
to increase or
decrease the numbers as needed, like this.
00:03:53.960 --> 00:03:58.510
Then OK to confirm each measurement and
to and to move onto the next measurement.
00:03:58.510 --> 00:04:00.310
Once you've added the last measurement,
00:04:00.310 --> 00:04:03.740
the information display will show
you all of the entered measurements.
00:04:03.740 --> 00:04:06.255
If correct select confirm and hit OK.
00:04:07.400 --> 00:04:10.570
Once you confirm the measurements
the system will automatically search for
00:04:10.570 --> 00:04:13.720
the sticker target and
highlight it with the red circle.
00:04:13.720 --> 00:04:15.990
A message will ask if
the sticker is circled.
00:04:15.990 --> 00:04:18.590
If it is, select Yes to confirm.
00:04:18.590 --> 00:04:21.730
You'll get a confirmation message
letting you know set-up is complete and
00:04:21.730 --> 00:04:22.640
measurements are saved.
00:04:23.870 --> 00:04:26.850
If you do not see the sticker circled,
select no.
00:04:26.850 --> 00:04:29.210
Make sure the measurements are correct,
and that the trailer and
00:04:29.210 --> 00:04:31.530
vehicle are positioned straight.
00:04:31.530 --> 00:04:35.710
Finally, you'll need to drive the vehicle
straight forward between four and
00:04:35.710 --> 00:04:37.340
25 miles per hour as directed,
00:04:37.340 --> 00:04:41.100
until you get a message confirming
calibration is complete.
00:04:41.100 --> 00:04:44.100
Keep in mind,
once you input your trailer's information
00:04:44.100 --> 00:04:47.360
into the information display,
it is stored for easy recall.
00:04:47.360 --> 00:04:49.960
So, you'll only need to do this one time.
00:04:49.960 --> 00:04:52.868
Every additional trailer will
require repeating the process.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg5.mp4
question: How fast do i have to drive forward to get a "Calibration Complete" notification?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:01:34.980 --> 00:01:39.300
One more thing, if at any time you lose an
electrical connection to the trailer, you'll
00:01:39.300 --> 00:01:42.330
see a warning message in the instrument
cluster and hear an audible alert.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg6.mp4
question: What will happen if you lose connection to the trailer?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:02:09.570 --> 00:02:13.270
You may also notice that the charge
cord has multiple LED indicators
00:02:13.270 --> 00:02:17.580
to indicate that charging is in progress
or if any problems have occurred.
00:02:17.580 --> 00:02:21.340
When plugged into an AC outlet,
and you see a solid green light,
00:02:21.340 --> 00:02:24.080
power is available, but
vehicle charging has not begun.
00:02:25.470 --> 00:02:27.770
A flashing green light means
the vehicle is charging.
00:02:28.960 --> 00:02:32.270
If you see a flashing
solid red triangle LED,
00:02:32.270 --> 00:02:37.290
a ground fault circuit interrupter fault
or charge cord fault has been detected.
00:02:37.290 --> 00:02:41.610
However, if at any time you see a flashing
amber LED light in the shape of an outlet
00:02:41.610 --> 00:02:46.020
plug, that means high temperature
at the AC plug has been detected.
00:02:46.020 --> 00:02:48.610
Have the outlet checked by
a qualified electrician and
00:02:48.610 --> 00:02:50.839
make sure the AC plug fits
firmly into the outlet.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg7.mp4
question: what does a flashing red symbol mean?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:43.120 --> 00:00:46.710
The information displayed will
now show a green indicator light,
00:00:46.710 --> 00:00:50.400
the current gap setting,
and your desired set speed.
00:00:50.400 --> 00:00:53.040
And a vehicle graphic will
illuminate if the system detects
00:00:53.040 --> 00:00:54.590
a vehicle in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg4.mp4
question: How do I set my desire  set speed?

video_name: Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk
video_trans:
00:00:24.910 --> 00:00:29.540
To close it, you can kick your leg under
the bumper again, or simply push the lift
00:00:29.540 --> 00:00:33.700
gate close button located on
the bottom of the lift gate, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk_seg3.mp4
question: What are two ways you can close the lift gate?

video_name: Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI
video_trans:
00:00:12.640 --> 00:00:14.360
Here's how it works.
00:00:14.360 --> 00:00:18.500
Auto Start Stop automatically turns on
at startup unless you decided to turn it
00:00:18.500 --> 00:00:22.840
off using the on off button located
on the center console, here.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:25.570
You'll know it's activated when
you see the start-stop icon
00:00:25.570 --> 00:00:28.180
illuminated in your instrument cluster.
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:29.590
When you put your foot on the brake and
00:00:29.590 --> 00:00:33.690
come to a full stop, like at a red light,
your engine shuts off.
00:00:33.690 --> 00:00:35.580
You might not even notice it, but
00:00:35.580 --> 00:00:38.800
a light on the instrument cluster
will let you know the engine is off.
00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:39.580
But don't worry.
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.100
Your climate control settings, radio,
and head lamps will function normally.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:45.870
And when you take your
foot off the brake pedal,
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.710
your car automatically restarts,
without any delay.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Start-Stop F-150 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kuuirhd2vtI_seg2.mp4
question: What does the Auto Start/Stop function do?

video_name: Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E
video_trans:
00:00:44.220 --> 00:00:46.456
Okay, now let's talk about SelectShift.
00:00:46.456 --> 00:00:47.911
[MUSIC]
00:00:47.911 --> 00:00:52.109
To use it,
move your gear shift to the S position.
00:00:52.109 --> 00:00:55.615
And press the plus-minus buttons on
the the side of the gear shift to
00:00:55.615 --> 00:00:56.425
select gears.
00:00:56.425 --> 00:01:00.255
Press plus to upshift and
minus to downshift.
00:01:00.255 --> 00:01:03.488
Keep in mind your engine will rev
at various speeds depending on
00:01:03.488 --> 00:01:05.080
what gear you've shifted to.
00:01:05.080 --> 00:01:07.638
If your engine RPM is too high or too low,
00:01:07.638 --> 00:01:11.408
your vehicle will automatically
make some shifts for you.

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:00:41.765 --> 00:00:45.610
Okay, now let's talk about how
to replace the 12-volt battery.
00:00:45.610 --> 00:00:48.657
It's located inside the cabin,
under the driver's seat.
00:00:48.657 --> 00:00:52.470
First, you'll need to move
the driver's seat all the way back.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:56.351
Next, open the two plastic screw covers
on each side of the front of the seat,
00:00:56.351 --> 00:01:00.729
by inserting your finger into the tabs and
pulling them open, they'll swing inward.
00:01:00.729 --> 00:01:06.481
Now remove the two rail stop bolts
using a T-40 type Torx bit, here.
00:01:06.481 --> 00:01:10.071
With the arm rests folded up,
slide the seat all the way forward.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg3.mp4
question: Where is the 12 volt battery located?

video_name: Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek
video_trans:
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:31.890
Here, you can change the mode to alert
00:00:31.890 --> 00:00:34.440
which will vibrate your steering
wheel if you start to drift.
00:00:36.040 --> 00:00:39.990
Aid, which uses the steering system to
help direct you to steer the car back
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:40.886
into the target lane.
00:00:40.886 --> 00:00:44.480
Or Alert + Aid which gives
you both sets of cues.
00:00:45.870 --> 00:00:48.870
Unlike when you're in the alert mode,
in the combined mode,
00:00:48.870 --> 00:00:52.520
you won't feel the alert vibration
until you're further out of your lane.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System - Programming  Ford How-To _ Ford-jzG6YDWMWek_seg3.mp4
question: How does aid + alert mode work?

video_trans:

Still with me?
00:00:44.710 --> 00:00:46.930
Great, then let's move on.
00:00:46.930 --> 00:00:49.210
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:49.210 --> 00:00:52.970
you'll want to have the towing screen up
on your 8-inch productivity screen.
00:00:52.970 --> 00:00:56.120
To get there, use the five-way
switch on your steering wheel,
00:00:56.120 --> 00:00:58.180
scroll to the right to the Towing tab.
00:00:58.180 --> 00:01:00.890
Select Towing Status, and hit OK.
00:01:00.890 --> 00:01:02.810

00:01:02.810 --> 00:01:04.940
This is what we talked about earlier.
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:08.170
And the progress bar that lights up to
show you the amount of power going to
00:01:08.170 --> 00:01:11.000
the trailer brakes when you're
foot is on the brake pedal.
00:01:11.000 --> 00:01:15.390
Unless a trailer is connected,
the display will read no trailer detected.

video_name: Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8
video_trans:
00:00:16.950 --> 00:00:20.190
Before you begin you'll need a few
things to help with the set up.
00:00:20.190 --> 00:00:24.425
Your supplied quick start set up guide
with measurement card, a tape measure,
00:00:24.425 --> 00:00:27.408
a pen or pencil, and
an assistant to help out if needed.
00:00:27.408 --> 00:00:30.308
As well as the checkered stickers
that comes with your guide
00:00:30.308 --> 00:00:32.915
which I'll tell you about later.
00:00:32.915 --> 00:00:36.985
First, you'll need to connect your vehicle
to your trailer on a level surface.
00:00:36.985 --> 00:00:41.105
For best results, it's recommended to use
a drawbar with the appropriate rise or
00:00:41.105 --> 00:00:43.025
drop to position your
trailer level to the ground.
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:47.030
Then, line up the vehicle and
trailer by pulling forward so
00:00:47.030 --> 00:00:48.270
they're in line with one another.
00:00:49.800 --> 00:00:54.330
Second, from inside the vehicle, use
the five-way steering wheel controls and
00:00:54.330 --> 00:00:59.200
go to the Towing menu, and select Trailer
Setup, then Add Trailer, and hit OK.
00:01:00.780 --> 00:01:04.940
Using the up and down and left and right
arrows of the five-way controls, spell out
00:01:04.940 --> 00:01:09.030
the name of the trailer using the right
arrow to advance to the next letter.
00:01:09.030 --> 00:01:11.020
Press OK to confirm.
00:01:11.020 --> 00:01:13.842
Next, select the type of brake system for
your trailer.
00:01:13.842 --> 00:01:17.260
Electric/Surge is the default,
then press OK.
00:01:18.470 --> 00:01:21.850
Now, select the brake effort for
your trailer: Low,
00:01:21.850 --> 00:01:26.190
which is the recommended setting for
most trailers, Medium, or High.
00:01:26.190 --> 00:01:29.770
If your trailer requires more aggressive
braking, like if you have a larger,
00:01:29.770 --> 00:01:34.815
heavier trailer for instance, you will
then need to select a trailer type.
00:01:34.815 --> 00:01:38.346
And since automatic features are only
available with conventional trailers
00:01:38.346 --> 00:01:41.288
within trailer reverse guidance,
trailer setup is required.
00:01:41.288 --> 00:01:44.288
If you choose not to set up
your conventional trailer, or
00:01:44.288 --> 00:01:46.787
if you have a Fifth wheel or
Gooseneck trailer,
00:01:46.787 --> 00:01:49.985
you can still use the trailer
reverse guidance views.
00:01:49.985 --> 00:01:53.105
But, some of the automatic
features will not available.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Setting Up Trailer Reverse Guidance _ Ford How-To _ Ford-M0Y7QXobCD8_seg2.mp4
question: What is the inside vehicle process when you are doing the setup?

video_name: Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ
video_trans:
00:01:10.071 --> 00:01:13.546
To access the battery compartment
on Transit Wagon models,
00:01:13.546 --> 00:01:17.973
first remove the protective plastic
molding, by pulling up on the tabs, and
00:01:17.973 --> 00:01:19.420
sliding it towards you.
00:01:19.420 --> 00:01:23.326
Next, lift the fabric covered trim by
pulling up on the tabs, and tuck, or
00:01:23.326 --> 00:01:25.074
fold it to keep it out of your way.
00:01:25.074 --> 00:01:28.962
You'll need to remove the rear metal
battery cover by unscrewing two fastening
00:01:28.962 --> 00:01:30.130
bolts, here and here.
00:01:31.350 --> 00:01:34.113
Next, unfasten the two electrical cords,
00:01:34.113 --> 00:01:38.526
by unclipping them from the fasteners
like this, and remove the bar.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Battery Location _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xglmBiyTifQ_seg4.mp4
question: What is supposed to be removed first when accessing the battery compartment?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:22.880 --> 00:00:24.570
When ready to charge the vehicle,
00:00:24.570 --> 00:00:28.560
first be sure that the cord is
completely unwound to avoid overheating.
00:00:28.560 --> 00:00:33.250
And plug the AC plug into an AC outlet,
making sure to use a dedicated line that
00:00:33.250 --> 00:00:37.010
no other appliances are connected to,
to avoid tripping a circuit.
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:40.910
Then, connect the charging coupler
to the charge port on the vehicle.
00:00:40.910 --> 00:00:43.410
You'll know it's properly attached
when you hear a click and
00:00:43.410 --> 00:00:44.760
the lock release button pops up.
00:00:45.830 --> 00:00:49.580
The FORD charge port LED lights
will flash in sequence two times,
00:00:49.580 --> 00:00:52.540
to confirm an electrical
connection has been made.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8_seg3.mp4
question: Why is using a dedicated power outlet line that no other appliances are connected to, important?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:01:09.710 --> 00:01:12.960
And finally, to extend the life
of the bright chrome grill and
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:17.600
other exterior trim parts, wax all
finishes regularly, especially before and
00:01:17.600 --> 00:01:19.050
after the winter season.
00:01:19.050 --> 00:01:22.100
Polishing and waxing can
maintain the finishes luster and
00:01:22.100 --> 00:01:24.580
help eliminate the occurrence
of rust spots.
00:01:24.580 --> 00:01:28.740
For best results, wipe residue off
using a microfiber detailing cloth and
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:30.530
following product directions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg4.mp4
question: What parts of the truck should you wax regularly especially before and after the winter season?

00:01:48.390 --> 00:01:49.960

video_name: How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.081 --> 00:00:03.902
[MUSIC]
00:00:03.902 --> 00:00:06.147
Your vehicle may be equipped
with power outlets,
00:00:06.147 --> 00:00:09.900
where you can charge devices like laptops,
rechargeable power tools, and more.
00:00:09.900 --> 00:00:12.030
Let me explain.
00:00:12.030 --> 00:00:14.190
There are two outlets in your vehicle.
00:00:14.190 --> 00:00:18.710
One in the instrument panel, here, and
one in the rear of the center console
00:00:18.710 --> 00:00:21.650
that is easily accessible for
someone in the back seat.
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:25.510
The outlets can charge when your truck is
running ,and can deliver up to 400 watts
00:00:25.510 --> 00:00:29.650
when you're parked or idling, and
up to 300 watts when you're driving.
00:00:29.650 --> 00:00:33.970
Keep in mind, when using power tools,
the power outlets are only to be used for
00:00:33.970 --> 00:00:37.600
recharging and
should not be used as a main power source.
00:00:37.600 --> 00:00:38.303
Any questions?
00:00:38.303 --> 00:00:40.149
Go to Owner.Ford.com.
00:00:40.149 --> 00:00:50.149
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/How to Use the F-Series 110-Volt Power Outlets _ Ford How-To _ Ford-b3Sw3NUj8wo_seg1.mp4
question: What can the power outlets charge?

video_trans:

00:00:03.963 --> 00:00:06.130
Why do my headlamps automatically turn on?
00:00:07.520 --> 00:00:09.500
>> How do I get my headlamps
to turn on automatically?
00:00:10.530 --> 00:00:14.620
>> Your vehicle may be equipped with
automatic headlamps, or autolamp.
00:00:14.620 --> 00:00:18.610
It's easy to tell, just look for
this icon on your headlamp controls.
00:00:18.610 --> 00:00:22.530

00:00:22.530 --> 00:00:23.630

video_trans:
00:01:14.090 --> 00:01:18.120
When the system is on,
you'll see a car icon with lane markings.
00:01:18.120 --> 00:01:20.900
If the lines are gray,
you're either driving too slow for
00:01:20.900 --> 00:01:24.500
the system to work,
the road has poor lane markings, or
00:01:24.500 --> 00:01:27.020
the camera cannot see the markings
because of weather conditions.

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4
question: When is adaptive steering most useful?

video_name: 60_40 Split Fold-Down Rear Seat Backs _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eBdnZEs9Iw4
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.348 --> 00:00:05.553
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.553 --> 00:00:07.440
Can these seat backs be folded down?
00:00:09.560 --> 00:00:11.150
>> Can I fold down just one side?
00:00:13.200 --> 00:00:15.320
>> Did you know that you
can fold down one or
00:00:15.320 --> 00:00:17.780
both of the rear seat
backs in your vehicle?
00:00:17.780 --> 00:00:21.680
And that's helpful when carrying
longer items like skis or golf bags.
00:00:21.680 --> 00:00:23.740
Here's how to do it.
00:00:23.740 --> 00:00:27.110
Find the release on top of the seat
back you want to fold down.
00:00:27.110 --> 00:00:31.715
Then, just push or pull up to release
the seat back and fold it down.
00:00:31.715 --> 00:00:35.235
Do the same thing on the other side
if you want to fold them both down.
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:38.175
You'll get a full pass through
from the trunk that way.
00:00:38.175 --> 00:00:42.601
And for your convenience, the 2013 Fusion
Hybrid battery has been moved to the floor
00:00:42.601 --> 00:00:45.349
of the trunk, so
it won't block the pass through.
00:00:45.349 --> 00:00:47.900
And there's a clip that holds
your safety belts in place, so
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.305
they won't get caught behind
when folding your seat back.
00:00:51.305 --> 00:00:52.395
Any questions?
00:00:52.395 --> 00:00:53.862
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:53.862 --> 00:00:54.529
[MUSIC]
