video_name: Dynamic Hitch Assist _ Ford How-To _ Ford-JgPTe-ZM9sk
video_trans:
00:00:10.139 --> 00:00:14.473
Dynamic Hitch Assist is part of the rear
view camera system on your truck.
00:00:14.473 --> 00:00:17.767
It helps you line up the center of the
truck to your trailer from inside using
00:00:17.767 --> 00:00:20.606
a black dotted line that moves
when you move the steering wheel.
00:00:20.606 --> 00:00:24.800
The black line is displayed on
your eight inch LCD touchscreen.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:27.165
Because you can see the exact
angle of your truck and
00:00:27.165 --> 00:00:31.015
trailer the whole time you're backing up,
you can line up your truck's hitch with
00:00:31.015 --> 00:00:34.454
the trailer without a spotter and
without getting out of your truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Dynamic Hitch Assist _ Ford How-To _ Ford-JgPTe-ZM9sk_seg2.mp4
question: Do I need a spotter to line up my hitch to the trailer?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:01:56.180 --> 00:01:58.840
And here are a few other tips
you might be interested in.
00:01:58.840 --> 00:02:02.180
To cool down your vehicle quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:02.180 --> 00:02:05.850
turn the nob toward the cool
setting to reduce the temperature.
00:02:05.850 --> 00:02:08.476
To warm your vehicle up quickly,
press the Auto button, and
00:02:08.480 --> 00:02:11.160
turn your nob toward the warm
setting to increase it.
00:02:11.740 --> 00:02:16.036
To quickly defrost the windshield and side
windows, press the Max defrost button.
00:02:16.036 --> 00:02:17.348
Both the temperature and
00:02:17.348 --> 00:02:21.070
fan speed will automatically
adjust to the highest settings.
00:02:21.070 --> 00:02:21.710
In mild or
00:02:21.710 --> 00:02:25.910
warm temperatures, you may notice
that your A/C automatically turns on.
00:02:25.910 --> 00:02:29.300
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg9.mp4
question: What is the finishing color of the system?

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
00:01:14.500 --> 00:01:18.180
To program additional buttons, repeat
the steps we just walked through, but
00:01:18.180 --> 00:01:20.190
remember to choose a different button.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg3.mp4
question: Do I use a new button?

video_name: Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI
video_trans:
00:00:30.900 --> 00:00:33.885
To set up and receive a vehicle
health report via your email,
00:00:33.885 --> 00:00:36.690
you'll first need to login
to your owner account.
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:39.990
If you've not logged in before,
you'll need to register.
00:00:39.990 --> 00:00:43.550
Just your name, email address, ZIP code,
00:00:43.550 --> 00:00:48.480
your vehicle identification number or
VIN and your mobile phone number.
00:00:48.480 --> 00:00:52.230
Once you've logged in, click on
the Service and Maintenance tab to set up
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:57.560
reports, then Vehicle Health Report and
click Manage Notifications.
00:00:57.560 --> 00:01:01.810
Then you may need to scroll down the page
and select Email a detailed summary.
00:01:01.810 --> 00:01:03.510
Finally, click Save.
00:01:03.510 --> 00:01:05.660
Now, you're ready to
receive email updates.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Viewing a Vehicle Health Report Through Email _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1RkKJGLRCpI_seg2.mp4
question: What is the first thing you do to set up and receive your vehicle's health record?

video_name: Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s
video_trans:
00:00:37.235 --> 00:00:40.425
You can also drive your car if
it's been started remotely.
00:00:40.425 --> 00:00:43.815
With the car already running,
just press the brake and
00:00:43.815 --> 00:00:48.110
push the ENGINE START STOP button or
turn the key and you're ready to drive.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Remote Start System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-SPppfyT5M5s_seg3.mp4
question: Does the car start with a button.

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:00:46.420 --> 00:00:50.420
There's also a small white car icon in the
upper left corner of your touch screen.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.680
It lets you know which camera view is
being used, for example, 360 view,
00:00:54.680 --> 00:00:56.840
split view, etc..
00:00:56.848 --> 00:01:00.550
The icon highlights will change when
you switch from one view to another.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg5.mp4
question: What direction can the camera go?

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:40.620 --> 00:01:44.480
When in reverse, you can change the camera
view you see by using the camera button on
00:01:44.480 --> 00:01:48.280
the dash above the screen and pushing
it until you get the view you want.
00:01:48.280 --> 00:01:51.390
Keep in mind, the change camera view
function only works when you're
00:01:51.390 --> 00:01:55.210
driving forward at six miles per hour or
below for safety purposes.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI_seg9.mp4
question: How do you change the camera view you see?

video_name: Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ
video_trans:
00:01:04.600 --> 00:01:08.660
For even more cargo room,
you can also remove the seats completely.
00:01:08.660 --> 00:01:12.770
To do so, just follow the same steps
you used to tumble them forward.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:15.530
Then grab the yellow release
lever underneath the seat bottom,
00:01:15.530 --> 00:01:18.820
pull up to unlock it from the floor
mounts, then lift them out.
00:01:20.320 --> 00:01:21.098
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 5-Passenger - 2nd-Row Folding Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-HHKY6z6BUhQ_seg3.mp4
question: Can seats be removed completely for even more cargo room in the vehicle?

video_name: Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck
video_trans:
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:12.670
Great, now let's talk about what to do
if your lights do need to be adjusted.
00:01:12.670 --> 00:01:16.450
Or if you're going to be towing
something and need to move them.
00:01:16.450 --> 00:01:20.920
First, open your hood, do you see
the adjuster on your head lamps?
00:01:22.118 --> 00:01:26.320
With your screwdriver, twist each one
until your beams are at the right level.
00:01:26.320 --> 00:01:28.830
And remember to leave the marks
on your door or wall so
00:01:28.830 --> 00:01:31.700
that you can readjust the lights
back when you need to.
00:01:31.700 --> 00:01:32.670
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Headlamp Adjustment _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Sp3McTgj4ck_seg5.mp4
question: What tool do you need to use if your headlights need adjusting?

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:01:04.590 --> 00:01:07.780
Using the navigation system
has also been simplified, so
00:01:07.780 --> 00:01:12.750
finding your nearest favorite coffee shop,
ATM, or any other popular destination
00:01:12.750 --> 00:01:17.580
can now be done quickly, thanks to
condensed destination entry functionality.
00:01:17.580 --> 00:01:21.530
Plus SYNC 3 remembers what you searched,
like coffee shops and
00:01:21.530 --> 00:01:23.200
saves it in its memory.
00:01:23.200 --> 00:01:26.820
So the next time you search for
a coffee shop, it'll remember and preload
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:30.800
POI search results based on the letters
you type and show you the closest one.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek_seg4.mp4
question: Does the navigation remembers what I've searched before?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en

[MUSIC]
00:00:05.522 --> 00:00:08.722
Your vehicle comes with a feature that
can help prevent you from accidentally
00:00:08.722 --> 00:00:13.030
shifting into reverse while shifting into
a forward gear on a manual transmission.
00:00:13.030 --> 00:00:15.280
It's called the reverse
lock-out pull ring.
00:00:15.280 --> 00:00:16.330
Let me tell you about it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Reverse Lock-Out Pull Ring _ Ford How-To _ Ford-6WJlQFNhowI_seg1.mp4

video_name: Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk
video_trans:
00:02:05.218 --> 00:02:09.733
And finally, smart trailer tow connector
informs you of trailer connectivity
00:02:09.733 --> 00:02:13.653
issues, such as burned out lights,
and trailer battery problems.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Towing Overview _ Ford How-To _ Ford-yRbKET3t5sk_seg9.mp4
question: How can I check light issues?

video_name: Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk
video_trans:
00:01:09.710 --> 00:01:12.960
And finally, to extend the life
of the bright chrome grill and
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:17.600
other exterior trim parts, wax all
finishes regularly, especially before and
00:01:17.600 --> 00:01:19.050
after the winter season.
00:01:19.050 --> 00:01:22.100
Polishing and waxing can
maintain the finishes luster and
00:01:22.100 --> 00:01:24.580
help eliminate the occurrence
of rust spots.
00:01:24.580 --> 00:01:28.740
For best results, wipe residue off
using a microfiber detailing cloth and
00:01:28.740 --> 00:01:30.530
following product directions.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Chrome Care _ Ford How-To _ Ford-kI8f6UFhYDk_seg4.mp4
question: How can I protect the chrome on my vehicle from rust?

video_name: Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0
video_trans:
00:02:12.160 --> 00:02:16.400
To unfold the second row seats,
pull the longer strap on the seat back up.
00:02:16.400 --> 00:02:20.020
When you feel it unlock from the floor,
move the entire seat back and
00:02:20.020 --> 00:02:22.690
push down until you feel it
lock into position again.
00:02:22.690 --> 00:02:24.622
And until you hear it click.
00:02:24.622 --> 00:02:27.481
Finally, pull up on the short strap and
flip the seat back up.
00:02:27.481 --> 00:02:30.019
[MUSIC]
00:02:30.019 --> 00:02:31.043
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Transit Connect 7-Passenger - 2nd- and 3rd-Row Seats _ Ford How-to _ Ford-NATJ7Y9_BU0_seg5.mp4

video_name: Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c
video_trans:
00:02:00.120 --> 00:02:01.030
One more thing,
00:02:01.030 --> 00:02:05.170
to help prevent locking the key fob inside
of the vehicle when using the door lock,
00:02:05.170 --> 00:02:09.670
depending on how the vehicle is set up,
if left inside you may hear a horn chirp
00:02:09.670 --> 00:02:13.120
indicating the fob has been left in
the vehicle and the doors will not lock.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Available Intelligent Access with Push-Button Start _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0Xb4dnL401c_seg7.mp4

video_name: Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw
video_trans:
00:01:23.240 --> 00:01:24.670
One more thing.
00:01:24.670 --> 00:01:27.310
When storing summer tires,
be sure to store them
00:01:27.310 --> 00:01:32.024
away from direct heating devices where
the temperatures are above 19 degrees Fahrenheit
00:01:32.024 --> 00:01:36.900
as lower temperatures may
result in loss of rubber flexibility and
00:01:36.900 --> 00:01:39.470
develop surface cracks in the treads.
00:01:39.470 --> 00:01:43.636
If the tires have been stored and
conditioned at 19 degrees or cooler,
00:01:43.636 --> 00:01:47.190
warm them to 41 degrees Fahrenheit for
at least 24 hours
00:01:47.190 --> 00:01:50.510
before installing them on a vehicle or
checking the tire pressure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Summer Tires _ Ford How-to _ Ford-MQ-4Ix-C3Rw_seg3.mp4
question: how many kilometer speed this vehicle ?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en

[MUSIC]
00:00:03.554 --> 00:00:05.600
>> Why do people keep flashing
their headlamps at me?
00:00:06.850 --> 00:00:09.810
>> Why do my headlamps seem too
high when I'm towing my boat?
00:00:11.810 --> 00:00:13.705
>> Why am I having a hard
time seeing the road?
00:00:15.255 --> 00:00:17.945
>> If you're adding extra weight
to the rear of your vehicle,
00:00:17.945 --> 00:00:22.375
such as hauling a trailer or boat,
it may make your headlamps appear unlevel.
00:00:23.565 --> 00:00:26.220
And that might mean you'll
have to readjust them.
00:00:26.220 --> 00:00:27.370
I know what you're thinking.
00:00:27.370 --> 00:00:29.830
But don't worry, this won't be hard.

video_name: Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU
video_trans:
00:01:02.570 --> 00:01:05.090
You can change the sensitivity
of the warning system
00:01:05.090 --> 00:01:09.630
to one of three settings by using the
five-way control on your steering wheel.
00:01:09.630 --> 00:01:14.240
Scroll to Driver Assist,
Pre-Collision, Alert Sensitivity, and
00:01:14.240 --> 00:01:17.290
then select High, Normal or Low.
00:01:17.290 --> 00:01:21.350
A lower setting can send fewer warnings,
while a higher setting will give earlier,
00:01:21.350 --> 00:01:22.890
more frequent warnings.
00:01:22.890 --> 00:01:26.820
Keep in mind, for the system to
function properly, the radar sensor and
00:01:26.820 --> 00:01:29.130
camera must be clear of obstruction.
00:01:29.130 --> 00:01:33.660
If any obstruction is detected, a message
will appear in the information display.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Pre-Collision Assist with Pedestrian Detection _ Ford How-To _ Ford-TVgSeHMSXEU_seg4.mp4
question: What is the difference between the 3 option settings of the warning system?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:01:00.295 --> 00:01:03.545
If you plan on towing a trailer or
boat for example, you'll need to
00:01:03.545 --> 00:01:08.390
activate the tow/haul feature by pressing
the button on the gear shift lever, here.
00:01:08.390 --> 00:01:11.540
The Tow Haul indicator will
illuminate in the instrument cluster,
00:01:11.540 --> 00:01:14.470
indicating that tow/haul
mode is now activated.
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:17.518
To deactivate,
simply press the button again.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg3.mp4
question: How is the tow/haul feature deactivated?

video_trans:
00:01:22.590 --> 00:01:26.600
A green bar indicates a positive
effect on your EV range,
00:01:26.600 --> 00:01:29.150
while an amber bar indicates
a negative effect.
00:01:29.150 --> 00:01:32.110
The longer the bar, the larger the impact.

Just push up on the stalk to the single
triangle for a normal, continuous wipe, or
00:00:48.970 --> 00:00:50.840
to the double triangle for faster wiping.
00:00:52.090 --> 00:00:54.560
To wash the windshield,
just pull the stock towards you.
00:00:55.630 --> 00:00:57.840
So far, so good, right?

Here's one more thing you should know.
00:01:18.500 --> 00:01:21.640
To wash the rear windows push

The washer will spray for

video_name: Enhanced Upfitter Switches _ Ford How-To _ Ford-O7a4J7B17zs
video_trans:
00:00:13.280 --> 00:00:14.500
For your convenience,
00:00:14.500 --> 00:00:19.130
built in upfitter switches have been moved
to the overhead console for easy access.
00:00:19.130 --> 00:00:23.000
Plus, we've increased the number
of switches from four to six.
00:00:23.000 --> 00:00:27.292
So now, you have more capability to
control components, such as winches,
00:00:27.292 --> 00:00:29.580
electric spreaders, lights and more.

video_name: Selectable Driving Modes _ Ford How-To _ Ford-w6Hgwxu8zXI
video_trans:
00:01:03.660 --> 00:01:06.870
Track provides more of
a performance driving experience
00:01:06.870 --> 00:01:10.650
as the engine responds directly to your
input, and takes on a more powerful tone.
00:01:10.650 --> 00:01:15.280
When you're in track mode a performance
oriented advance track calibration
00:01:15.280 --> 00:01:17.020
is automatically selected.
00:01:17.020 --> 00:01:21.110
And the usual advance track intervention
is reduced and tunes specifically for
00:01:21.110 --> 00:01:22.550
race track usage.

video_trans:

00:00:03.852 --> 00:00:07.690
Your vehicle has some convenient storage
spaces for things like spare change,
00:00:07.690 --> 00:00:09.220
media devices and more.
00:00:09.220 --> 00:00:09.970
Let me show you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Storage   Mustang _ Ford How-To _ Ford-oF8We3Di4Z0_seg1.mp4
question: What has a convenient storage space?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:00:25.340 --> 00:00:27.780
To turn adaptive cruise control on,
press and
00:00:27.780 --> 00:00:30.690
release the on off switch
on your steering wheel.
00:00:30.690 --> 00:00:33.560
The information display will
show a gray indicator light
00:00:33.560 --> 00:00:35.470
as well as the current gap setting.
00:00:35.470 --> 00:00:38.170
Now, accelerate to the speed you want,
00:00:38.170 --> 00:00:40.720
press the set button on your wheel and
release.
00:00:40.720 --> 00:00:43.120
Then take your foot off the accelerator.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg3.mp4
question: in what order do you press the controls accessible on the steering wheel?

video_name: LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk
video_trans:
00:00:43.330 --> 00:00:46.262
To operate,
simply press either the left or right or
00:00:46.262 --> 00:00:48.405
both side mirror spot light buttons.
00:00:48.405 --> 00:00:52.102
Plus, driver and passenger security
approach lamps illuminate the area
00:00:52.102 --> 00:00:54.350
around the front doors of your vehicle.
00:00:54.350 --> 00:00:58.841
And come on automatically when you
unlock the doors using your key fob, or
00:00:58.841 --> 00:01:00.588
any time you open the doors.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/LED Lighting Features _ Ford How-To _ Ford-eAHk8oAbhyk_seg3.mp4
question: Can both the side mirror lights turn on at once?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:00:23.520 --> 00:00:27.080
To get to the screen, use the five-way
switch on your steering wheel and
00:00:27.080 --> 00:00:33.070
scroll to Engage, Empower, MyView,
and then Miles/Full Charge.
00:00:33.070 --> 00:00:36.730
This screen will also show up when
you select EV Now mode using the EV
00:00:36.730 --> 00:00:37.640
button here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg3.mp4
question: How the Miles/Full charge screen be accessed?

video_name: Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA
video_trans:
00:00:44.190 --> 00:00:46.160
Now, let me show you how it works.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:50.420
The LATCH system consists of three
anchor points to secure your child seat.
00:00:50.420 --> 00:00:54.850
The two lower anchors in the seat bite,
where the back and the seat cushion meet.
00:00:54.850 --> 00:00:58.860
And the top tether anchor on the back
of or behind the vehicle seat, here.
00:01:00.520 --> 00:01:04.110
Attach the metal connectors on
the bottom of your child seat, remember,
00:01:04.110 --> 00:01:08.320
the ones that are either rigid or
on a strap, to the anchors,
00:01:08.320 --> 00:01:11.350
which may be marked with
a child seat symbol, here.
00:01:11.350 --> 00:01:12.870
If your seat has straps,
00:01:12.870 --> 00:01:16.060
tighten them by pulling up until
the seat is secure and doesn't move.
00:01:16.060 --> 00:01:19.780
If your clips are on a rigid attachment,
push your seat back and
00:01:19.780 --> 00:01:23.270
forth after you've attached it,
to make sure it doesn't move.
00:01:23.270 --> 00:01:27.190
Once you've installed your child seat with
the lower anchors of the latch system,
00:01:27.190 --> 00:01:31.910
attach the top tether strap under the head
rest, or over the top of the head
00:01:31.910 --> 00:01:36.010
restraint, if it's not adjustable or
removable, and tighten the strap.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Child Tether LATCH System Help Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4tUQ6xsTLKA_seg4.mp4
question: How many anchors are in the latch system?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:00:44.181 --> 00:00:46.430
To adjust the gap setting,
press the up and
00:00:46.430 --> 00:00:49.590
down arrows on your steering
wheel control switch.
00:00:49.590 --> 00:00:52.240
Pressing it up decreases your
follow distance setting and
00:00:52.240 --> 00:00:54.330
allows your car to follow
at a closer distance.
00:00:55.530 --> 00:00:58.530
And pressing it down, increases
your follow distance setting, and
00:00:58.530 --> 00:01:01.460
expands the distance between you and
a car in front of you.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg4.mp4
question: What button increases your follow distance?

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:14.380 --> 00:00:16.190
It works a lot like
standard cruise control,
00:00:16.190 --> 00:00:19.196
in that it still maintains
your speed on flat roadways.
00:00:19.196 --> 00:00:21.470
But with ECO Cruise,
when you tap the brake, and
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.410
then want to resume your previously set
speed, it accelerates gradually to get
00:00:25.410 --> 00:00:29.100
your vehicle back up to speed and
that can help save energy.
00:00:29.100 --> 00:00:33.160
Be aware that you may experience some
speed loss when first going up hill but
00:00:33.160 --> 00:00:37.110
after a short period of time,
it will catch up to your set speed.
00:00:37.110 --> 00:00:39.380
And if equipped with
adaptive cruise control,
00:00:39.380 --> 00:00:43.320
when your vehicle speed is slowed, it will
automatically accelerate again gradually
00:00:43.320 --> 00:00:47.890
once traffic is cleared. That gradual
acceleration may make it seem as if your
00:00:47.890 --> 00:00:50.930
vehicle isn't keeping up with
the speed you've set, it is.
00:00:50.930 --> 00:00:53.710
It's just that its more efficient
to gradually accelerate.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM_seg2.mp4
question: what is the difference between Adaptive cruise control and eco- cruise control?

video_name: MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM
video_trans:
00:00:17.846 --> 00:00:22.105
Using the five-way controls on your
steering wheel, scroll to the main menu,
00:00:22.105 --> 00:00:25.400
Display/Trip, then scroll to MyView and
00:00:25.400 --> 00:00:27.740
press the right arrow on
the five-way controls.
00:00:27.740 --> 00:00:31.030
It takes you to the Options menu
where you can select Change MyView.
00:00:31.030 --> 00:00:35.100
From here, simply use the up or
down arrows to view the available content,
00:00:35.100 --> 00:00:39.280
like Vehicle Range, Trip 1 and
2, Fuel History, Coach, etc,
00:00:39.280 --> 00:00:43.030
and the right and left arrows to move
between the left and right columns.
00:00:44.360 --> 00:00:46.710
Each time you select a screen
that you want to display,
00:00:46.710 --> 00:00:49.650
press the OK button on your
five-way control to save it.
00:00:49.650 --> 00:00:51.980
This will now be your MyView screen.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/MyView _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gpmYDUDW1bM_seg2.mp4
question: Which arrows do you use to look at the available content on the Change My View option?

video_name: Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg
video_trans:
00:00:12.040 --> 00:00:14.290
First, let's talk about the accelerometer.
00:00:14.290 --> 00:00:16.080
It's part of the Track Apps feature.
00:00:16.080 --> 00:00:19.410
Using the five-way switch on the left
side of your steering wheel,
00:00:19.410 --> 00:00:21.410
select Track Apps in the Main Menu.
00:00:21.410 --> 00:00:23.822
Accelerometer, and press OK.
00:00:23.822 --> 00:00:27.630
The accelerometer displays
the vehicle's rate of acceleration, or
00:00:27.630 --> 00:00:30.672
deceleration on a virtual
gauge in the cluster, here.
00:00:30.672 --> 00:00:34.035
A red indicator dot in the center of
the gauge indicates the vehicle's
00:00:34.035 --> 00:00:37.630
longitudinal, and
latitudinal acceleration in real time.
00:00:37.630 --> 00:00:39.720
And updates it constantly.
00:00:39.720 --> 00:00:43.110
The numbers on the outside of the ring
represent the maximum accelerations
00:00:43.110 --> 00:00:44.580
since the last reset values.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Accelerometer_Acceleration Timer _ Ford How-To _ Ford-0WtDHkyZJxg_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the switch to access the menu located?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:02:11.050 --> 00:02:15.020
And one more thing, If you wish to
change to the conventional cruise mode,
00:02:15.020 --> 00:02:19.220
go to the menu settings on your instrument
cluster and select Cruise Control and
00:02:19.220 --> 00:02:20.110
then choose Normal.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg10.mp4
question: How do change back to the conventional cruise control mode?

video_name: Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc
video_trans:
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:52.500
To use Launch Control, select Launch
Control under the Track App menu.
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.105
Once enabled quickly press
the accelerator all the way to the floor.
00:00:56.105 --> 00:00:58.365
The feature will automatically
set your preferred RPM.
00:00:58.365 --> 00:01:01.535
You'll know it's set when you see
the set icon in the lower right
00:01:01.535 --> 00:01:02.795
corner of the display.
00:01:02.795 --> 00:01:03.296
When ready,
00:01:03.296 --> 00:01:06.265
quickly release the clutch while
maintaining pressure on the accelerator.
00:01:06.265 --> 00:01:08.252
[MUSIC]
00:01:08.252 --> 00:01:09.580
One more thing.
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.110
You can turn it off by
following the same steps.
00:01:12.110 --> 00:01:14.220
Simply select Launch Control and press OK.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Track Apps - Launch Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-nRxAFnKQCyc_seg3.mp4
question: How to set the desired RPM?

video_name: Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ
video_trans:
00:00:15.090 --> 00:00:18.154
Your vehicle's rear view
mirror has two pivot points,
00:00:18.154 --> 00:00:21.621
one at the rear of the mirror housing and
one at the windshield.
00:00:21.621 --> 00:00:25.173
To adjust the mirror stem,
grab a hold of the mirror housing, and
00:00:25.173 --> 00:00:29.380
with a little pressure,
pull down to lower and push up to raise.
00:00:29.380 --> 00:00:31.430
It can also be pivoted side to side.
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:35.620
The mirror housing can also
be adjusted left or right and
00:00:35.620 --> 00:00:37.692
tilted up or down with a little pressure.
00:00:37.692 --> 00:00:39.436
It's that simple.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ_seg2.mp4
question: Which ways can the mirror be adjusted?

video_name: Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E
video_trans:
00:00:18.653 --> 00:00:22.840
Here's how, to use Sport Mode,
move your gear shift to the S position.
00:00:22.840 --> 00:00:24.277
[MUSIC]
00:00:24.277 --> 00:00:27.210
It gives you extra braking on
various grades of road and
00:00:27.210 --> 00:00:30.864
lets you use lower gears if you're
on a hilly or mountainous drive.
00:00:30.864 --> 00:00:35.105
Keep in mind, Sport Mode shifts at
higher engine speeds than drive mode, so
00:00:35.105 --> 00:00:37.306
your engine may run faster than usual.
00:00:37.306 --> 00:00:39.697
But that doesn't mean
you've lost any power.
00:00:39.697 --> 00:00:44.220
And remember, your vehicle will stay in
Sport Mode until you shift out of it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Drive vs. Sport Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7I38idrdK2E_seg2.mp4
question: What mode does putting the shifter to S put you in?

video_name: Powerpoints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DRkQOe83jAY
video_trans:
00:00:23.260 --> 00:00:26.534
The Power Points will stay powered
after you've turned off your ignition.
00:00:26.534 --> 00:00:29.224
So, that you can keep charging
your devices even after you've
00:00:29.224 --> 00:00:30.094
left your vehicle.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Powerpoints _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DRkQOe83jAY_seg3.mp4

The Power Points will stay powered
after you've turned off your ignition.
00:00:26.534 --> 00:00:29.224
So, that you can keep charging
your devices even after you've
00:00:29.224 --> 00:00:30.094
left your vehicle.

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:11.045 --> 00:00:15.500
Lane-keeping system is made up
of two parts, Alert and Aid.
00:00:16.700 --> 00:00:18.860
The Alert mode lets you know if
you're drifting out of your lane.
00:00:19.928 --> 00:00:24.740
Using three short vibrations, it warns you
to steer your vehicle back into your lane.
00:00:24.740 --> 00:00:28.180
If you want to change the strength
of the vibration your car gives you,
00:00:28.180 --> 00:00:31.245
you can adjust the intensity
setting in the message center.
00:00:31.245 --> 00:00:33.680
Lane-keeping will remember
the changes you make, so
00:00:33.680 --> 00:00:36.640
you won't have to reset it the next
time you turn on the system.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I_seg2.mp4
question: what are the two parts of Lane-keeping system?

video_name: Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA
video_trans:
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:29.400
Let me explain, adaptive steering with
tow/haul mode, changes the ratio between
00:00:29.400 --> 00:00:32.570
the driver's actions with the steering
wheel, meaning how much the driver
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:36.630
turns the steering wheel, and
how much the front wheels actually turn.
00:00:36.630 --> 00:00:39.660
At slower speeds, this allows
the front wheels to fully turn,
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.520
with fewer rotations
of the steering wheel,
00:00:42.520 --> 00:00:45.980
which is helpful when performing
low speed maneuvers like parking.
00:00:45.980 --> 00:00:48.280
When traveling at higher speeds,
on a highway for
00:00:48.280 --> 00:00:52.500
instance, this feature further
optimizes the steering response,
00:00:52.500 --> 00:00:56.235
enabling the vehicle to react more
precisely to driver input and
00:00:56.235 --> 00:00:59.065
provide a smoother vehicle response
to your steering wheel input.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Steering with Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-GMocOHfM5yA_seg2.mp4
question: What is adaptive steering with tow haul?

video_name: Customer-Placed Trailer Camera _ Ford How-To _ Ford-ylZSsi3RHqs
video_trans:
00:00:35.700 --> 00:00:38.331
Once installed, when shifted into reverse,
00:00:38.331 --> 00:00:42.858
pressing the auxiliary button on your
Sync 3 touchscreen turns the camera on.
00:00:42.858 --> 00:00:45.430
A rear view image will then appear
on your center console display.
00:00:45.430 --> 00:00:48.532
The camera will turn off when
shifted out of reverse, or
00:00:48.532 --> 00:00:51.910
when another camera view is
selected from the touch screen.

Green, yellow, or red highlights show up
wherever the closest object detected is
00:00:44.943 --> 00:00:46.414
when you're in reverse.

manually change gears,

the current gap setting,

And a vehicle graphic will

video_name: SecuriCode Invisible Keypad Owner Guide _ Ford How-To _ Ford-fAfBR_UIK4Q
video_trans:
00:00:32.214 --> 00:00:35.677
Speaking of codes, your keypad comes
with one that's preprogrammed.
00:00:35.677 --> 00:00:39.395
Just enter that five digit code
to unlock the driver's door.
00:00:39.395 --> 00:00:42.880
Then press 3 4 to unlock all the doors.
00:00:42.880 --> 00:00:46.016
To pop your trunk or
your manual lift gate, enter the code.
00:00:46.016 --> 00:00:48.168
Then press 5-6.
00:00:48.168 --> 00:00:53.185
To lock all of your doors,
press 7-8 and 9-0 at the same time.
00:00:53.185 --> 00:00:54.032
[MUSIC]

video_trans:

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:13.160 --> 00:00:14.870
With your front seats upright, look for
00:00:14.870 --> 00:00:18.560
the storage latch on the bottom
of the middle seat cushion, here.
00:00:18.560 --> 00:00:20.860
Pull the latch to release the seat and
pull it back.
00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E_seg2.mp4
question: where is the storage latch located?

video_name: Adjusting 2nd and 3rd Row Seats _ Ford How-To _ Ford-OllpuMmMqFM
video_trans:
00:01:05.570 --> 00:01:08.790
If you want to tumble or
fold your entire seat forward for
00:01:08.790 --> 00:01:10.720
easier access to the third row,
00:01:10.720 --> 00:01:14.840
pull the handle up all the way until
the seat releases from the floor.
00:01:14.840 --> 00:01:18.350
Then flip the whole seat forward by
grabbing the bottom and pushing it up.

video_trans:
00:00:15.650 --> 00:00:19.640
Adaptive cruise control maintains
a pre-set gap by adjusting the vehicle's
00:00:19.640 --> 00:00:22.250
speed so you don't need to
constantly use your brake and
00:00:22.250 --> 00:00:25.340
accelerator to adjust with
the speed of traffic.

video_name: 6-Speed SelectShift Automatic Transmission _ Ford How-To _ Ford-h0mpG7CSWgc
video_trans:
00:00:17.320 --> 00:00:20.822
Here's how it works, to use SelectShift,
00:00:20.822 --> 00:00:24.333
move your gear shift into S,
or Sport Mode.
00:00:24.333 --> 00:00:27.600
If your vehicle has the select shift
controls on the steering wheel,
00:00:27.600 --> 00:00:32.040
you'll pull the right paddle to upshift,
or the left paddle to downshift.
00:00:32.040 --> 00:00:35.990
If your controls are located on the
Shifter, you upshift by pressing the plus
00:00:35.990 --> 00:00:40.590
button on the Gear Shift Lever, or
downshift by pressing the minus button.

video_name: BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78
video_trans:
00:00:26.290 --> 00:00:28.460
When a vehicle enters into
a lane to the right or
00:00:28.460 --> 00:00:33.215
left, BLIS warns you with a solid light
on the corresponding side view mirror.
00:00:33.215 --> 00:00:36.115
The light will stay on until the vehicle
has moved out of your blind spot.
00:00:37.155 --> 00:00:39.805
Also, whenever you
activate your turn signal,
00:00:39.805 --> 00:00:42.995
if a vehicle is within the blind
spot zone, BLIS will give you
00:00:42.995 --> 00:00:46.465
a flashing light warning on
the corresponding side view mirror.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/BLIS with Trailer Coverage and Cross-Traffic Alert _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pGvXi1Bse78_seg3.mp4
question: What does BLIS do to warn you of passers by?

video_name: Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs
video_trans:
00:01:50.650 --> 00:01:54.288
To heat your car up and defrost
the windshield and side windows quickly,
00:01:54.288 --> 00:01:58.296
adjust the temperature control to your
desired setting or select max defrost.
00:01:58.296 --> 00:02:01.446
This will automatically turn your
air distribution to defrost,
00:02:01.446 --> 00:02:06.180
set the temperature to the hottest level
and the air flow to the maximum setting.
00:02:06.180 --> 00:02:10.650
In mild or warm temperatures you may
notice that your A/C also turns on.
00:02:10.650 --> 00:02:13.320
It does this to help dehumidify
the air for defogging.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Climate Controls - Fiesta _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2YHmJtzFRPs_seg7.mp4
question: When shouldn't recirculated air be selected?

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w
video_trans:
00:01:52.860 --> 00:01:54.050
When towing a trailer,
00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308
pressing the Tow/Haul mode button located
at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220
activates the tow/haul feature which will
allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130
to automatically follow at
a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120
This is handy since the extra
weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control Using Tow_Haul Mode _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xe7aziYMt6w_seg9.mp4
question: What does turning on the Tow Haul feature do to the adaptive cruise control system?

video_name: Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.456
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.456 --> 00:00:07.616
Your vehicle has a capless fuel filler
that saves time at the pump and
00:00:07.616 --> 00:00:09.680
keeps your hands cleaner.
00:00:09.680 --> 00:00:13.010
There's no cap to twist off and
it's simple to use.
00:00:13.010 --> 00:00:16.510
Just open your fuel door by either
putting a finger under the exposed tab
00:00:16.510 --> 00:00:17.530
on the door.
00:00:17.530 --> 00:00:19.800
Or by pushing it in a bit
until it releases and
00:00:19.800 --> 00:00:21.470
you can open it the rest of the way.
00:00:21.470 --> 00:00:25.440
Insert the nozzle all the way,
making sure it goes through both flaps.
00:00:25.440 --> 00:00:29.290
Fill up, then wait five seconds
before removing the nozzle and
00:00:29.290 --> 00:00:30.780
close the fuel door.
00:00:30.780 --> 00:00:32.840
If you're using a portable fuel container,
00:00:32.840 --> 00:00:36.160
you'll need to use the easy fuel funnel
provided with your vehicle to avoid
00:00:36.160 --> 00:00:38.470
damaging the seals on
the spring loaded flaps.
00:00:39.540 --> 00:00:43.720
And one more thing, to help protect
against fuel theft, splashing, or
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:47.770
water getting in the tank, the capless
fuel filler is tamper resistant.
00:00:47.770 --> 00:00:51.440
And the self closing, spring loaded flaps
help keep fuel from sloshing out and
00:00:51.440 --> 00:00:54.550
water from leaking in when it rains or
when you wash your vehicle.
00:00:54.550 --> 00:00:55.650
Any questions?
00:00:55.650 --> 00:00:56.919
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:56.919 --> 00:01:06.919
[MUSIC]
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Easy Fuel Capless Fuel Filler _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Eh3snbTNR1k_seg1.mp4
question: Does the care come with a capless fuel filler?

00:00:08.061 --> 00:00:11.794

video_trans:
00:00:04.983 --> 00:00:07.064
Did you know that you can
manually change gears,
00:00:07.064 --> 00:00:09.550
even though your car has
an automatic transmission?
00:00:09.550 --> 00:00:14.760
Let me explain, with SelectShift,
not only can you easily shift gears,
00:00:14.760 --> 00:00:17.320
you don't have to worry about

video_name: Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0
video_trans:
00:00:14.740 --> 00:00:18.920
The forward collision warning with brake
support, uses a radar sensor to detect
00:00:18.920 --> 00:00:22.445
slower moving vehicles traveling
in the same direction as you and
00:00:22.445 --> 00:00:24.880
warns you if you're
rapidly approaching them.
00:00:24.880 --> 00:00:28.520
If this happens, a red warning light
will illuminate on your windshield and
00:00:28.520 --> 00:00:30.110
the warning chime will sound.
00:00:30.110 --> 00:00:33.120
If you don't react after the alert and
continue to get closer to
00:00:33.120 --> 00:00:36.870
the other vehicle, the system will
pre-charge your breaks for rapid breaking.
00:00:36.870 --> 00:00:39.420
So, they can respond faster once
you do press your brake pedal.
00:00:40.470 --> 00:00:43.720
Once your brakes have been pre-charged,
even if you press them lightly,
00:00:43.720 --> 00:00:46.300
they'll apply full stopping
power to help stop you quickly.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Forward Collision Warning with Brake Support - F-Series _ Ford How-To _ Ford-1MCegMMMIS0_seg2.mp4
question: What speed is necessary to initiate forward collision warning with brake support?

video_name: Lane Keeping System _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2K62ZvQis4I
video_trans:
00:00:50.623 --> 00:00:54.582
Great, let's take a closer look at
what you'll see from the driver seat.
00:00:54.582 --> 00:00:56.689
If you want to use this system press,
00:00:56.689 --> 00:01:00.600
the on/off switch at the end
of the left hand star.
00:01:00.600 --> 00:01:01.850
Depending on your model,
00:01:01.850 --> 00:01:04.640
you may have to turn it on every
time you turn on your car.
00:01:04.640 --> 00:01:07.359
In other models, the system will
recall the last remembered settings.
00:01:08.420 --> 00:01:10.490
If you started the vehicle using MyKey,
00:01:10.490 --> 00:01:14.090
the system will turn on automatically
with the alert mode selected.

Great, let's take a closer look at
what you'll see from the driver seat.
00:00:54.582 --> 00:00:56.689
If you want to use this system press,
00:00:56.689 --> 00:01:00.600
the on/off switch at the end
of the left hand star.
00:01:00.600 --> 00:01:01.850
Depending on your model,
00:01:01.850 --> 00:01:04.640
you may have to turn it on every
time you turn on your car.
00:01:04.640 --> 00:01:07.359
In other models, the system will
recall the last remembered settings.
00:01:08.420 --> 00:01:10.490
If you started the vehicle using MyKey,
00:01:10.490 --> 00:01:14.090
the system will turn on automatically
with the alert mode selected.

video_name: Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc
video_trans:
00:00:11.450 --> 00:00:13.100
Using the information display, and
00:00:13.100 --> 00:00:16.150
the five way control switch on
the left side of your steering wheel,
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:19.500
you can choose whether you want
your running lamps on or off.
00:00:19.500 --> 00:00:24.380
Just scroll to Settings, Vehicle,
Lighting, then Daytime Lights.
00:00:24.380 --> 00:00:26.750
If you have your daytime
running lamps set to on and
00:00:26.750 --> 00:00:30.430
want to use them, turn the lighting
control to the auto lamp position.
00:00:30.430 --> 00:00:34.110
When the lighting control is in auto lamp
position, and the head lamps are off,
00:00:34.110 --> 00:00:37.099
the daytime running lamps will turn
on automatically when you're driving.
00:00:38.530 --> 00:00:41.770
And will switch between daytime
running lamps and headlamps as needed.
00:00:41.770 --> 00:00:45.150
Based on how light or dark it is outside,
and whether or not the wipers are on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Configurable Daytime Running Lamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-HeJaJ_ufDuc_seg2.mp4
question: How is it necessary to shift to auto lamp postiion to turn on daytime lights?

video_trans:

The Search channels using voice command,

steering wheel, wait for
00:01:32.680 --> 00:01:37.990
the beep then say browse Sirius, and
a full list of categories will appear.
00:01:37.990 --> 00:01:42.270
Touch the one you want to hear and once
you decide, touch the voice button and
00:01:42.270 --> 00:01:45.390
then say the channel number,
like, Sirius channel 36.
00:01:45.390 --> 00:01:50.290
Or you can use the Voice button and just
say the name or number of the channel,
00:01:50.290 --> 00:01:54.200
like ALT Nation, for example,
and it will tune to that channel.

00:01:54.050 --> 00:01:58.308

at the end of the gear shift lever, here,
00:01:58.308 --> 00:02:03.220

allow the adaptive cruise control system
00:02:03.220 --> 00:02:06.130

a slightly greater distance.
00:02:06.130 --> 00:02:09.120

weight of a trailer requires more
00:02:09.120 --> 00:02:11.050
breaking distance if needed.

video_name: Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA
video_trans:
00:00:11.960 --> 00:00:14.580
First, keep in mind that
convertible top fabric
00:00:14.580 --> 00:00:16.710
does not promote mildew growth itself.
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:20.705
Mildew may develop on dirt or
other foreign substances if not removed.
00:00:20.705 --> 00:00:25.090
So keeping the fabric clean through
regular washings will enhance the life and
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:26.696
beauty of the top material.
00:00:26.696 --> 00:00:29.595
When washing vehicles
with cloth top roofs.
00:00:29.595 --> 00:00:33.012
Start by vacuuming with a soft
bristle brush attachment and
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:35.070
be sure to use a non detergent soap.
00:00:35.070 --> 00:00:40.925
Scrub gently in a circular pattern using
a terrycloth towel or soft bristle brush.
00:00:40.925 --> 00:00:44.030
More specifically horse hair or
soft nylon.
00:00:44.030 --> 00:00:45.950
Do not use stiff bristle brushes or
00:00:45.950 --> 00:00:49.420
any abrasive materials or
cleaners as they can damage the fabric.
00:00:50.840 --> 00:00:54.760
When finished, rinse thoroughly
removing all soap residues.
00:00:54.760 --> 00:00:59.040
Allow the top to air dry completely
before folding it otherwise, mold or
00:00:59.040 --> 00:01:02.340
mildew may develop and
discolor the cloth material.
00:01:02.340 --> 00:01:07.090
To clean away lint debris like cottonwood,
use a standard clothes lint roller or
00:01:07.090 --> 00:01:09.320
a vacuum attachment with
a soft bristle brush.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA_seg2.mp4
question: What is the price of the car?

video_name: Electric Vehicle Charge Cord _ Ford How-To _ Ford-wQPORipGnZ8
video_trans:
00:00:52.540 --> 00:00:56.902
To access the charge port light
preferences, using the touchscreen,
00:00:56.902 --> 00:01:00.113
touch settings, vehicle,
and charge port light.
00:01:00.113 --> 00:01:01.307
[MUSIC]
00:01:01.307 --> 00:01:03.600
The default setting is on.
00:01:03.600 --> 00:01:07.480
This means the port lights will illuminate
when you plug in, when the vehicle is
00:01:07.480 --> 00:01:13.080
charging, and anytime you press the unlock
button on your key fob or open the doors.
00:01:13.080 --> 00:01:16.370
Selecting Limited will prevent the port
lights from coming on while the vehicle
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:17.860
is charging.
00:01:17.860 --> 00:01:20.410
And Off will disable
all lighting features.

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:53.710 --> 00:00:56.530
When ECO Cruise is on but
not active, the ECO and
00:00:56.530 --> 00:00:59.880
car icon in your information
display will be gray.
00:00:59.880 --> 00:01:03.720
Once active both ECO and
the car icon will turn green.
00:01:03.720 --> 00:01:06.140
Now just accelerate to the speed you want.
00:01:06.140 --> 00:01:09.450
Then press the set button on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:01:09.450 --> 00:01:12.770
Your vehicle will keep a constant
speed until you brake.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:17.190
Keep in mind, if you do brake but
then want to resume your set speed again,
00:01:17.190 --> 00:01:20.490
you can press the resume button on
the left side of your steering wheel.

video_trans:

When you come to a stop, the Brake Coach
screen appears in your display.
00:00:36.120 --> 00:00:38.830
And shows you your
braking efficiency score.
00:00:38.830 --> 00:00:41.820
You'll get higher percentages by
coming to gradual stops and
00:00:41.820 --> 00:00:46.220

your braking efficiency.

If at any time you want a quick
refresher on what this feature is,
00:00:49.076 --> 00:00:52.260
use the five way control on the left
side of your steering wheel.

Go to the Main Menu,
scroll to Information, Tutorial,
00:00:56.420 --> 00:00:59.320
then select Brake Coach and
a brief description will appear.

video_trans:
00:00:10.810 --> 00:00:14.600
For starters, your vehicle has
a high-strength steel frame with enhanced
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.454
stiffness and
durability to help control your trailer.
00:00:17.454 --> 00:00:20.870
It also has something called
the Smart Trailer Tow Connector.
00:00:20.870 --> 00:00:24.692
You can access it under the towing tab
in the eight-inch productivity screen.
00:00:24.692 --> 00:00:27.872
It provides you with trailer connection
status along with lighting and
00:00:27.872 --> 00:00:30.510
trailer battery alerts, and warnings.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Towing _ Ford How-To _ Ford-7qSiTwFoiqQ_seg2.mp4
question: What helps us to connect the trailer for the car?

video_name: Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk
video_trans:
00:01:00.340 --> 00:01:02.980
Of course, if you'd rather not
use the Brake Coach feature,
00:01:02.980 --> 00:01:05.170
you can disable it using
the five-way control.
00:01:05.170 --> 00:01:12.317
Going back to your Settings menu,
then Display, Brake Coach, and Off.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Brake Coach _ Ford How-To _ Ford-r1S_Jshm4Kk_seg4.mp4
question: What menu is the brake coach under after Settings?

video_name: Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk
video_trans:
00:01:32.110 --> 00:01:36.530
Keep in mind, the estimated range is
based on three impact categories.
00:01:36.530 --> 00:01:40.440
The first being driving style and
route, which is the energy used to
00:01:40.440 --> 00:01:45.160
propel your vehicle, like acceleration and
breaking behavior, road grades, and
00:01:45.160 --> 00:01:47.630
whether you're doing city or
highway driving.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Electric Range and Reading the Gauges _ Ford How-To _ Ford-dR-BZWycAGk_seg8.mp4
question: How is the range estimated?

video_name: Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8
video_trans:
00:00:20.160 --> 00:00:23.250
The TBC control is located on
your center console, here.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:28.320
It has a manual slide control lever
that apply the trailer's electric brakes
00:00:28.320 --> 00:00:30.610
independently of the tow vehicle.
00:00:30.610 --> 00:00:32.360
And a plus and minus gain adjust button.
00:00:33.570 --> 00:00:35.610
Pressing either of them,
adjust how much or
00:00:35.610 --> 00:00:39.140
how little power the TBC sends
to your trailer's brakes.
00:00:39.140 --> 00:00:41.150
If you press and hold the button,
you can raise or
00:00:41.150 --> 00:00:43.660
lower the gain setting continuously.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Integrated Trailer Brake Controller (TBC) _ Ford How-To _ Ford-DwRdUnDjjJ8_seg3.mp4
question: What is the benefit to increasing or decreasing the Trailer Brake Control?

video_name: Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk
video_trans:
00:00:33.700 --> 00:00:37.760
If you don't want to use the hands-free
capability, you can always use the lift
00:00:37.760 --> 00:00:41.700
gate button on your key fob,
the button on the instrument panel, or
00:00:41.700 --> 00:00:45.000
the button located on the lift gate
handle just below the license plate.
00:00:46.060 --> 00:00:49.620
One more thing, if your vehicle is
equipped with an available trailer tow
00:00:49.620 --> 00:00:54.190
package, to open or close the lift gate,
just kick under the bumper to the left or
00:00:54.190 --> 00:00:56.120
right of the tow hitch.
00:00:56.120 --> 00:00:57.270
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Hands Free Liftgate _ Ford How-to _ Ford-nmWSzJn1Dfk_seg4.mp4

video_name: Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ
video_trans:
00:00:15.090 --> 00:00:18.154
Your vehicle's rear view
mirror has two pivot points,
00:00:18.154 --> 00:00:21.621
one at the rear of the mirror housing and
one at the windshield.
00:00:21.621 --> 00:00:25.173
To adjust the mirror stem,
grab a hold of the mirror housing, and
00:00:25.173 --> 00:00:29.380
with a little pressure,
pull down to lower and push up to raise.
00:00:29.380 --> 00:00:31.430
It can also be pivoted side to side.
00:00:32.570 --> 00:00:35.620
The mirror housing can also
be adjusted left or right and
00:00:35.620 --> 00:00:37.692
tilted up or down with a little pressure.
00:00:37.692 --> 00:00:39.436
It's that simple.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Double Pivot Mirror _ Ford How-To _ Ford-pdsBuJu7fnQ_seg2.mp4

video_name: Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA
video_trans:
00:00:11.960 --> 00:00:14.580
First, keep in mind that
convertible top fabric
00:00:14.580 --> 00:00:16.710
does not promote mildew growth itself.
00:00:16.710 --> 00:00:20.705
Mildew may develop on dirt or
other foreign substances if not removed.
00:00:20.705 --> 00:00:25.090
So keeping the fabric clean through
regular washings will enhance the life and
00:00:25.090 --> 00:00:26.696
beauty of the top material.
00:00:26.696 --> 00:00:29.595
When washing vehicles
with cloth top roofs.
00:00:29.595 --> 00:00:33.012
Start by vacuuming with a soft
bristle brush attachment and
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:35.070
be sure to use a non detergent soap.
00:00:35.070 --> 00:00:40.925
Scrub gently in a circular pattern using
a terrycloth towel or soft bristle brush.
00:00:40.925 --> 00:00:44.030
More specifically horse hair or
soft nylon.
00:00:44.030 --> 00:00:45.950
Do not use stiff bristle brushes or
00:00:45.950 --> 00:00:49.420
any abrasive materials or
cleaners as they can damage the fabric.
00:00:50.840 --> 00:00:54.760
When finished, rinse thoroughly
removing all soap residues.
00:00:54.760 --> 00:00:59.040
Allow the top to air dry completely
before folding it otherwise, mold or
00:00:59.040 --> 00:01:02.340
mildew may develop and
discolor the cloth material.
00:01:02.340 --> 00:01:07.090
To clean away lint debris like cottonwood,
use a standard clothes lint roller or
00:01:07.090 --> 00:01:09.320
a vacuum attachment with
a soft bristle brush.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Convertible Top Care and Cleaning _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IVVN_CbdRsA_seg2.mp4
question: What types of brushes are the best to use to clean the convertible top?

video_name: Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs
video_trans:
00:03:05.580 --> 00:03:08.610
To do so, touch the Alert button here.
00:03:08.610 --> 00:03:10.760
Then the Enable Alerts button.
00:03:10.760 --> 00:03:14.970
To set an alert, anytime you hear a song
or artist you want to be notified of,
00:03:14.970 --> 00:03:19.210
touch the Alert button,
choose either the artist, song title, or
00:03:19.210 --> 00:03:20.989
both, to add them to your alert.
00:03:22.030 --> 00:03:24.710
You'll get a message letting
you know they've been saved.
00:03:24.710 --> 00:03:26.470
Now, anytime that song or
00:03:26.470 --> 00:03:30.210
artist is being played on any channel
you'll receive a message on your screen
00:03:30.210 --> 00:03:35.150
asking if you'd like to tune to that
channel, delete, or disable alerts.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Using SiriusXM Satellite Radio With SYNC 3 _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vWuKT_SnkXs_seg10.mp4
question: What is the function of alert button?

video_name: F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550
video_trans:
00:00:52.590 --> 00:00:55.110
To use it, first press the Auto button.
00:00:55.110 --> 00:00:58.435
Then select the temperature you want
by simply turning the temperature
00:00:58.435 --> 00:00:59.320
control knob.
00:00:59.320 --> 00:01:02.250
You'll see your chosen temperature
displayed in the upper left corner
00:01:02.250 --> 00:01:02.760
of the screen.
00:01:03.770 --> 00:01:07.510
Now, each time you turn on your vehicle
with your climate control on, or
00:01:07.510 --> 00:01:09.320
turn on the A/C control,
00:01:09.320 --> 00:01:13.020
the system will automatically adjust
to reach your set temperature.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/F-150 Dual-Zone Electronic Automatic Temperature Control _ Ford How-To _ Ford-F7_yaT8R550_seg4.mp4
question: Where is the set vehicle cabin temperature indicated on the screen?

video_trans:

A green bar indicates a positive
effect on your EV range,
00:01:26.600 --> 00:01:29.150

a negative effect.
00:01:29.150 --> 00:01:32.110
The longer the bar, the larger the impact.

video_name: SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek
video_trans:
00:00:17.540 --> 00:00:21.110
An easy to read colorful homescreen
conveniently displays the phone and
00:00:21.110 --> 00:00:22.330
audio features.
00:00:22.330 --> 00:00:26.810
As well as new available navigation
screen, with a convientant swipe and
00:00:26.810 --> 00:00:29.808
pinch to zoom feature,
similar to your smart phone.
00:00:29.808 --> 00:00:33.160
And a redesigned feature bar is now
present along the bottom of the touch
00:00:33.160 --> 00:00:36.540
screen for a simple,
straightforward user experience.
00:00:36.540 --> 00:00:40.670
Keep in mind, if the feature menu bar
retracts below the display screen,
00:00:40.670 --> 00:00:44.270
you can simply touch the controls button
on the bottom left of the screen, here.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/SYNC 3 - All-New Enhanced Features _ SYNC 3 How-To _ Ford-6QwzEd4IKek_seg2.mp4

video_name: Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA
video_trans:
00:01:32.170 --> 00:01:34.792
Once the data of cruise is on,
it uses radar and
00:01:34.792 --> 00:01:39.048
camera technology to constantly scan for
slower vehicles in front of you.
00:01:39.048 --> 00:01:42.403
And automatically adjusts your
speed to maintain the gap.
00:01:42.403 --> 00:01:46.639
You may notice that on occasion, you go
slower than you initially set your cruise for.
00:01:46.639 --> 00:01:49.018
That's the system adjusting the speed.
00:01:49.018 --> 00:01:52.902
Once traffic speeds up,
you'll return to the speed you set.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop-and-Go _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LnUtjs-jeJA_seg7.mp4
question: How does adaptive cruise scan for vehicles?

video_trans:
00:01:09.286 --> 00:01:12.334
The trailer tire pressure
monitoring system, or TPMS,
00:01:12.334 --> 00:01:16.778
displays the individual tire pressure of
a connected trailer and provides an alert
00:01:16.778 --> 00:01:21.304
message in your instrument cluster if one or more is significantly under inflated
00:01:21.304 --> 00:01:22.244
[MUSIC]

video_trans:
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:21.010
To start, go to the Settings
menu on the touch screen.
00:00:21.010 --> 00:00:23.690
It's the one that looks like gears, here.
00:00:23.690 --> 00:00:27.230
From here, you could personalize
several of your SYNC 3 features.
00:00:27.230 --> 00:00:31.040
You can set the clock by touching the
Clock tile as well as set automatic time
00:00:31.040 --> 00:00:34.790

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:12.858 --> 00:00:16.194
The jack is located under
the passenger seat. To get to it,
00:00:16.194 --> 00:00:18.530
simply move the seat all the way forward,
00:00:18.530 --> 00:00:22.937
using either the power control button
located on the side closest to the door,
00:00:22.937 --> 00:00:26.650
or the manual adjust seat bar
located under the front of the seat.
00:00:26.650 --> 00:00:29.475
Lift the cover panel by pulling up on it.
00:00:29.475 --> 00:00:33.807
It's held in position with Velcro, so
just give it a little tug.
00:00:33.807 --> 00:00:38.574
Now unstrap the jack by stretching
the rubber hold down strap and releasing,
00:00:38.574 --> 00:00:39.684
then lift it out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg2.mp4
question: How do you unstrap the jack?

video_name: One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk
video_trans:
00:00:46.090 --> 00:00:48.750
For your safety, your windows
also have a bounce back feature.
00:00:48.750 --> 00:00:51.350
If you're closing a window and
it senses something in the way,
00:00:51.350 --> 00:00:53.450
it will automatically stop.
00:00:53.450 --> 00:00:55.750
That way, no one gets hurt and
nothing gets stuck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/One-Touch Power Windows _ Ford How-To _ Ford-cLKzpaEDdRk_seg5.mp4
question: What safety feature does the windows have?

video_trans:
00:01:28.318 --> 00:01:30.480
The Search channels using voice command,
00:01:30.480 --> 00:01:32.680
use the voice button on your
steering wheel, wait for
00:01:32.680 --> 00:01:37.990
the beep then say browse Sirius, and
a full list of categories will appear.
00:01:37.990 --> 00:01:42.270
Touch the one you want to hear and once
you decide, touch the voice button and
00:01:42.270 --> 00:01:45.390
then say the channel number,
like, Sirius channel 36.
00:01:45.390 --> 00:01:50.290
Or you can use the Voice button and just
say the name or number of the channel,
00:01:50.290 --> 00:01:54.200
like ALT Nation, for example,
and it will tune to that channel.

or how long your head lamps
00:00:41.420 --> 00:00:46.290
stay on after you've turned off your car,
use the information display controls.
00:00:46.290 --> 00:00:51.210
Press the down arrow to find settings,
then press OK and the right arrow.
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:55.520
And scroll down to vehicle, or
convenience depending on your vehicle.
00:00:55.520 --> 00:00:59.370
Next, press the right arrow and
scroll to auto lamp delay.
00:00:59.370 --> 00:01:03.880
Press the right arrow again,
select off or the time delay you wish.
00:01:03.880 --> 00:01:05.350
Then press OK to set it.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/What Are Autolamps _ Ford How-To _ Ford-vl7XcQJbn7I_seg3.mp4
question: What is the auto lamp time delay?

video_trans:

To unfold the second row seats,
pull the longer strap on the seat back up.
00:02:16.400 --> 00:02:20.020
When you feel it unlock from the floor,
move the entire seat back and
00:02:20.020 --> 00:02:22.690
push down until you feel it
lock into position again.
00:02:22.690 --> 00:02:24.622
And until you hear it click.
00:02:24.622 --> 00:02:27.481
Finally, pull up on the short strap and
flip the seat back up.

video_name: Dynamic Hitch Assist _ Ford How-To _ Ford-JgPTe-ZM9sk
video_trans:
00:00:10.139 --> 00:00:14.473
Dynamic Hitch Assist is part of the rear
view camera system on your truck.
00:00:14.473 --> 00:00:17.767
It helps you line up the center of the
truck to your trailer from inside using
00:00:17.767 --> 00:00:20.606
a black dotted line that moves
when you move the steering wheel.
00:00:20.606 --> 00:00:24.800
The black line is displayed on
your eight inch LCD touchscreen.
00:00:24.800 --> 00:00:27.165
Because you can see the exact
angle of your truck and
00:00:27.165 --> 00:00:31.015
trailer the whole time you're backing up,
you can line up your truck's hitch with
00:00:31.015 --> 00:00:34.454
the trailer without a spotter and
without getting out of your truck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Dynamic Hitch Assist _ Ford How-To _ Ford-JgPTe-ZM9sk_seg2.mp4
question: What does dynamic hitch assist do?

video_name: EcoCruise _ Ford How-To _ Ford-j3WpbQ9aDbM
video_trans:
00:00:53.710 --> 00:00:56.530
When ECO Cruise is on but
not active, the ECO and
00:00:56.530 --> 00:00:59.880
car icon in your information
display will be gray.
00:00:59.880 --> 00:01:03.720
Once active both ECO and
the car icon will turn green.
00:01:03.720 --> 00:01:06.140
Now just accelerate to the speed you want.
00:01:06.140 --> 00:01:09.450
Then press the set button on the left
side of your steering wheel.
00:01:09.450 --> 00:01:12.770
Your vehicle will keep a constant
speed until you brake.
00:01:12.770 --> 00:01:17.190
Keep in mind, if you do brake but
then want to resume your set speed again,
00:01:17.190 --> 00:01:20.490
you can press the resume button on
the left side of your steering wheel.

video_name: Cupholders for 40_20_40 Seat Configuration _ Ford How-To _ Ford-4QQouamp50E
video_trans:
00:00:13.160 --> 00:00:14.870
With your front seats upright, look for
00:00:14.870 --> 00:00:18.560
the storage latch on the bottom
of the middle seat cushion, here.
00:00:18.560 --> 00:00:20.860
Pull the latch to release the seat and
pull it back.
00:00:21.950 --> 00:00:23.390
To access the cup holders,
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:27.010
open the console lid, then lift
the cup holder tray out of the bin,
00:00:27.010 --> 00:00:32.330
spin it around, and latch it into place by
inserting the plastic tabs into the slots.
00:00:32.330 --> 00:00:35.180
Now push the seat cushion back into place.
00:00:35.180 --> 00:00:37.010
When you hear it latch,
you'll know it's secure.

video_name: Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g
video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.139 --> 00:00:04.420
[MUSIC]
00:00:04.420 --> 00:00:08.054
Programming your HomeLink system
is simple, let me show you how.
00:00:08.054 --> 00:00:10.470
First, turn on your car.
00:00:10.470 --> 00:00:13.491
Hold your old transmitter a couple of
inches away from the HomeLink button
00:00:13.491 --> 00:00:15.880
you want to control your garage door with.
00:00:15.880 --> 00:00:19.880
Now press and hold both the transmitter
button and the home link button
00:00:19.880 --> 00:00:24.560
until the indicator light changes from
a slow blink to a fast one, like this.
00:00:24.560 --> 00:00:27.520
Now, press and hold the button on your
HomeLink that you want to control
00:00:27.520 --> 00:00:30.950
your garage door for
five seconds and release it.
00:00:30.950 --> 00:00:35.120
Your garage door should, move but if it
doesn't, repeat the five second hold.
00:00:35.120 --> 00:00:39.230
If your indicator light is still on
your programming is complete and you can
00:00:39.230 --> 00:00:42.860
just press and release your HomeLink
button to activate your garage door.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Universal Garage Door Opener with Homelink _ Ford How-To _ Ford-f7S6XOOLF8g_seg1.mp4
question: How do I activate the homelink system?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.364
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.364 --> 00:00:09.020
Did you know that you can fold
the back seat down in your vehicle?
00:00:09.020 --> 00:00:10.590
Here's how to do it.
00:00:10.590 --> 00:00:13.670
First, fold the outside
head restraints down and
00:00:13.670 --> 00:00:16.160
lower the center head restraint like this.
00:00:16.160 --> 00:00:20.830
Next, find the lever located on
the side of the seat base, here, and
00:00:20.830 --> 00:00:22.920
pull the level up to
fold the seat back down.
00:00:24.180 --> 00:00:28.250
To unfold your seats, just pull the seat
back up into the lock position.
00:00:28.250 --> 00:00:28.920
You'll hear a click.
00:00:30.160 --> 00:00:31.300
And on some vehicles,
00:00:31.300 --> 00:00:34.870
you may see a red indicator on
the lever to let you know it's locked.
00:00:34.870 --> 00:00:36.584
Just give it a slight pull to make sure.
00:00:36.584 --> 00:00:40.486
Any questions?
00:00:40.486 --> 00:00:40.986
Go to www.FordOwner.com.
00:00:40.986 --> 00:00:50.942
[MUSIC]

video_name: Mustang Front-Seat Functionality _ Ford How-To _ Ford-LgqfbRlZOoc
video_trans:
00:01:06.820 --> 00:01:08.680
If you have the available power seats,
00:01:08.680 --> 00:01:12.510
using the switch located on the side of
the seat you can move the seats forward or
00:01:12.510 --> 00:01:15.320
backward by sliding it forward or
backward.
00:01:15.330 --> 00:01:18.970
To raise the seat bottom,
move the switch up or down.
00:01:20.160 --> 00:01:24.050
And to tilt, just lift the front of
the switch to tilt backward and
00:01:24.050 --> 00:01:25.500
press down to tilt forward.
00:01:25.500 --> 00:01:29.406
To set the firmest of the lumbar
support using the lumbar button,
00:01:29.406 --> 00:01:35.654
here, press the front of it to increase
the firmness and the back to decrease it.

The jack handle and lug wrench are located
in a storage compartment in the side of
00:00:43.216 --> 00:00:46.160
the passenger seat base, by the step well.
00:00:46.160 --> 00:00:49.460
Just put your fingers under
the two slots and pull it open.
00:00:49.460 --> 00:00:52.100
The six-piece jack handle
is inside a pouch,
00:00:52.100 --> 00:00:54.360
simply unsnap the three
straps to remove it.
00:00:55.560 --> 00:00:59.872
Now assemble the jack handle by inserting
the male end with the locking button into
00:00:59.872 --> 00:01:03.017
the tube, making sure it lines up and
snaps into position.
00:01:03.017 --> 00:01:05.545
Do the same with the remaining pieces.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg3.mp4
question: Where are the jack and the wrench located?

video_name: EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI
video_trans:
00:00:10.860 --> 00:00:14.460
To turn EcoSelect on,
simply press the Eco button located
00:00:14.460 --> 00:00:17.230
on the center console next
to the driver's seat.
00:00:17.230 --> 00:00:21.480
Here, you'll know it's on when you see
this icon in your information display.
00:00:21.480 --> 00:00:24.780
When activated, this feature is
designed to enhance fuel economy
00:00:24.780 --> 00:00:27.570
with some trade-offs in vehicle
performance and comfort.
00:00:27.570 --> 00:00:30.360
You may notice that your climate
system takes a bit longer to heat or
00:00:30.360 --> 00:00:33.880
cool the cabin, while also
altering other vehicle features.
00:00:33.880 --> 00:00:38.030
You may also experience less aggressive
acceleration and increased deceleration
00:00:38.030 --> 00:00:41.700
while coasting, which helps recharge
the battery more efficiently.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/EcoSelect _ Ford How-To _ Ford-Um28JeKN_iI_seg2.mp4
question: How do I turn the EcoSelect feature on?

video_name: Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk
video_trans:
00:01:28.840 --> 00:01:31.460
You'll also find
a Connection Checklist tab.
00:01:31.460 --> 00:01:33.332
Here, you can select a particular trailer,
00:01:33.332 --> 00:01:35.540
ensure you're wiring
is hooked up properly,
00:01:35.540 --> 00:01:39.030
your lights are functioning correctly,
and your mirrors are adjusted.
00:01:39.030 --> 00:01:42.310
Trailer Setup allows you to select
the type of trailer you're pulling
00:01:42.310 --> 00:01:45.470
such as Conventional,
Fifth Wheel, or Gooseneck.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Information Display - 4.2' Message Center _ Ford How-To _ Ford-paWjezqoxTk_seg5.mp4
question: What is in the connection checklist tab?

video_name: Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM
video_trans:
00:01:13.142 --> 00:01:18.280
To turn Auto Unlock on or off, follow
the steps to enter the programming mode.
00:01:18.280 --> 00:01:21.570
Then press the door lock button and
then the door unlock button.
00:01:21.570 --> 00:01:25.338
The horn will chirp once,
if Auto Unlock was turned off.
00:01:25.338 --> 00:01:31.646
Or twice [NOISE], one short chirp and one
long chirp, if Auto Unlock was turned on.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Auto Locks _ Ford How-To _ Ford-X9VXONMv7OM_seg5.mp4
question: What type of honks will sound if auto-unlock is turned on?

Your truck may be equipped with
power-deployable running boards that offer
00:00:08.317 --> 00:00:11.840
both style and convenience when
getting into and out of the cab.

Let me tell you about them.
00:00:12.968 --> 00:00:16.480
Convenient available
power-deployable running boards
00:00:16.480 --> 00:00:19.430
can be set to automatically extend and

To stow it, push the step in on either
side of the button until it fully latches
00:00:32.063 --> 00:00:33.116
into position.

video_name: Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U
video_trans:
00:00:12.858 --> 00:00:16.194
The jack is located under
the passenger seat. To get to it,
00:00:16.194 --> 00:00:18.530
simply move the seat all the way forward,
00:00:18.530 --> 00:00:22.937
using either the power control button
located on the side closest to the door,
00:00:22.937 --> 00:00:26.650
or the manual adjust seat bar
located under the front of the seat.
00:00:26.650 --> 00:00:29.475
Lift the cover panel by pulling up on it.
00:00:29.475 --> 00:00:33.807
It's held in position with Velcro, so
just give it a little tug.
00:00:33.807 --> 00:00:38.574
Now unstrap the jack by stretching
the rubber hold down strap and releasing,
00:00:38.574 --> 00:00:39.684
then lift it out.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Accessing the Vehicle Jack _ Ford How-To _ Ford-IAooaKIXe_U_seg2.mp4
question: Where is the jack located?

video_trans:
WEBVTT
Kind: captions
Language: en
00:00:00.405 --> 00:00:05.194
[MUSIC]
00:00:05.194 --> 00:00:09.670
Your vehicle may have a convenient feature
that you'll find helpful on sunny days.
00:00:09.670 --> 00:00:13.960
It's called the slide on rod sun visor
extension, and it adds an extra few inches
00:00:13.960 --> 00:00:17.200
to your sun visor arm to help
block the sunlight better.
00:00:17.200 --> 00:00:18.960
It's easy to use.
00:00:18.960 --> 00:00:21.650
Just rotate the visor toward
your side window, and
00:00:21.650 --> 00:00:23.610
pull it toward the rear
of the car to extend it.
00:00:24.730 --> 00:00:28.070
Then, push it back into
place to retract it.
00:00:28.070 --> 00:00:29.220
Any questions?
00:00:29.220 --> 00:00:30.742
Go to FordOwner.com.
00:00:30.742 --> 00:00:40.742
[MUSIC]

video_name: 360 Camera with Split-view Display _ Ford How-To _ Ford-2asWY4qcJtI
video_trans:
00:01:40.620 --> 00:01:44.480
When in reverse, you can change the camera
view you see by using the camera button on
00:01:44.480 --> 00:01:48.280
the dash above the screen and pushing
it until you get the view you want.
00:01:48.280 --> 00:01:51.390
Keep in mind, the change camera view
function only works when you're
00:01:51.390 --> 00:01:55.210
driving forward at six miles per hour or
below for safety purposes.

video_name: Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM
video_trans:
00:00:48.160 --> 00:00:49.250
Keep in mind,
00:00:49.250 --> 00:00:53.440
there are some factors that affect the
amount of energy being used while driving.
00:00:53.440 --> 00:00:57.330
For instance, mild or
aggressive acceleration or braking,
00:00:57.330 --> 00:01:01.905
your vehicle's speed, how much you use
accessories, such as climate control.
00:01:01.905 --> 00:01:06.232
The ambient temperature and other weather
conditions, as well as whether you're
00:01:06.232 --> 00:01:09.335
driving in the city or
on the highway, and the road grades.
00:01:09.335 --> 00:01:10.463
Any questions?
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Understanding Electric Range in Your Vehicle _ Ford How-To _ Ford-gutK9GAimkM_seg4.mp4
question: What are some things that effect the amount of energy being used while driving?

video_name: Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g
video_trans:
00:00:45.230 --> 00:00:47.680
In order to see what
the TBC is telling you,
00:00:47.680 --> 00:00:52.470
you'll want to have the trailer screen up
on your LCD productivity screen, here.
00:00:52.470 --> 00:00:54.840
To get there, go to Truck Apps,
00:00:54.840 --> 00:00:57.930
then push the right arrow twice
until you see the trailer display.
00:00:58.940 --> 00:01:03.460
Unless a trailer is connected, the display
will read, Trailer Disconnected.
00:01:03.460 --> 00:01:06.740
As soon as a trailer is connected,
you'll see this message.
00:01:06.740 --> 00:01:08.100
Press OK.
00:01:08.100 --> 00:01:12.680
Once the trailer connected message
goes away, you'll see gain setting.
00:01:12.680 --> 00:01:16.370
This is what we talked about earlier, and
a bar graph that lights up to show you
00:01:16.370 --> 00:01:19.390
the amount of power going
to the trailer brakes.
00:01:19.390 --> 00:01:23.960
From the trailer display, press OK, and
choose the Connection Checklist option.
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:27.640
It corresponds to
different trailer types and
00:01:27.640 --> 00:01:32.160
walks you through the connection process
to remind you of the necessary steps.
video_link: http://people.csail.mit.edu/rishabhy/split_videos/Trailer Brake Controller _ Ford How-To _ Ford-xcRGIiRIN3g_seg3.mp4
question: What will the display read unless a trailer is connected?

video_trans:

For more convenience,
a memory-fold seatback features allows for
00:00:49.860 --> 00:00:53.390
easier access to, or
exit from the rear seat.
00:00:53.390 --> 00:00:56.090
Just lift the lever located in
the center of the seatback,
00:00:56.090 --> 00:00:58.190
here, and
it will automatically spring forward.
00:00:59.210 --> 00:01:02.370
To return the seat back to its original
position, just push it back and
00:01:02.370 --> 00:01:05.800
it will return to the previous position
